column2: Sevens Enterprises Pvt Ltd is looking for Estimate Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.      You will play a crucial role in assessing project requirements, analyzing costs, and preparing accurate estimates for construction or engineering projects      This position involves collaboration with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure that project estimates align with budgetary and quality standards          Key Responsibilities:          Project Evaluation:Review project plans, specifications, and relevant documents to understand the scope and requirements of construction or engineering projects      Cost Analysis:Conduct detailed cost analysis for various project elements, including materials, labor, equipment, and subcontractor services      Collaborate with suppliers and subcontractors to obtain accurate pricing      Quantity Takeoff:Perform quantity takeoffs from project drawings and specifications to determine the quantity of materials needed for construction      Budget Preparation:Prepare comprehensive project cost estimates, considering all relevant factors and potential risks      Develop detailed budget breakdowns for labor, materials, equipment, overhead, and profit      Collaboration:Work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and constraints      Participate in pre-bid meetings and discussions to gather additional project insights      Bid Proposal Development:Assist in the preparation of bid proposals and tender documents      Ensure that bid submissions are accurate, competitive, and compliant with project specifications      Cost Control:Monitor project costs and update estimates based on changes in project scope, specifications, or market conditions      Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising quality      Risk Assessment:Evaluate potential risks and uncertainties associated with project estimates      Develop contingency plans and risk mitigation strategies      Documentation:Maintain detailed and organized records of project estimates, including supporting documentation and calculations      Provide documentation for internal and external audits      Software Utilization:Utilize estimating software and tools to enhance accuracy and efficiency in the estimation process      Stay updated on industry-standard estimating software          Qualifications and Skills:          Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field      Proven experience as an Estimate Engineer in the construction or engineering industry      Strong understanding of construction methods, materials, and project management      Proficiency in estimating software and Microsoft Office Suite      Excellent analytical and mathematical skills      Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in calculations      Effective communication and interpersonal skills      Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment      Knowledge of relevant industry regulations and standards      No of Vacancies - 8

column2: The Project Planning Manager provides expertise and best practice implementation about the planning and scheduling discipline, as he/she has a thorough understanding of advanced Planning and Scheduling techniques, Risk Management and analysis, and is able to support the Projects objectives             Task & Responsibilities         In order that planning and progress measurement are set-up in line with project strategy, you are to:         Be focal point and lead all planning set-up (WBS, OBS, and CBS) to establish the project schedule baseline.         Ensure planning and progress measurement set-up reflects contract scope of work, key milestones, client obligations and project requirements, using SBM planning templates as a basis, with activity coding that facilitates the schedule use and break out plans.         Develop the detailed schedule taking into consideration project constraints such as resource availability and project execution plan         Set-up/Define trackers and KPIs to be used throughout the Project.         Communicate the plan to all stakeholders and ensure full commitment.         The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:         Robustness of planning: critical path and schedule analysis definition.         Issue baseline level 3 schedule in accordance with the Project Controls Plan.         Efficient progress measurement systems and KPIs launch.         To manage planning and progress measurement activities, you are to:         Define and manage Planning Engineer(s) activities         Interface with all project disciplines.         Analyse (including the use of trending techniques) and comment with respect to, progress measurement, forecast completion dates, float analysis, KPIs, identify critical and near critical activities.      Leading to the anticipation of delay and alert the Project Team and propose corrective actions.         Provide input to project reporting re planning and progress measurement.         Provide leading indicators and trending for schedule performance         Provide ad-hoc analysis (such as Risk management, Claim, Change order, Re-baseline simulations) as required by the Project Team         Perform Schedule Risk Analysis as required.         The measure of your effectiveness in this will be   :       Capacity to consolidate and challenge planning forecast updates and recommends corrective actions.         Timely update of planning and progress measurement for project reporting.         In order that planning is closed-out, you are to:         Produce planning close-out per Company procedures         Identify lessons learnt         The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:         Submission and distribution of planning close-out report and the contribution to improvement of related processes         Education & Experience         Bachelors Degree in Engineering or Construction Management preferred.     Experienced professional with significant experience in Oil and Gas mainly in Offshore Production Unit EPC projects in the same position Yard exposure is a plus.     Has specialized knowledge of certain processes and has solid, profound experience within a specialized field.     Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint) Intermediate to Advanced is required.     Primavera Project Planner 6 (P6) Advanced is required.     A self- starter who possesses good interpersonal and organizational skills     Fluent in English (speaking and writing)
column11: SAP, Renewable energy, Coding, Project management, EPC, WBS, Project planning, Scheduling, Risk management, Construction management

column2: The Planning Engineer is the scheduler of the Project or major component of the Project.                          The Planning Engineer establishes the schedule and monitors the timely completion and progress of the Project by being the connector between all disciplines/activities, and reports to the Planning Manager or the Project Controls Manager (PCM).                              ROLE CONTRIBUTION                              1. In order that planning and progress measurement are set-up in line with project strategy, you are to:                            1.1. Develop/Execute the planning and progress measurement taking into consideration project constraints and project execution                          1.2. Set-up planning tools                          The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:                          Consistency of planning data and timeliness of the baseline schedule in accordance with the Project Controls Plan                            2. In order that planning and progress measurement are managed, you are to:                            2.1 Gather actuals progress data from disciplines and databases.                          2.2 Consolidate and check consistency of actual data.                          2.3 Challenge all project stakeholders involved with planning and progress measurement activities                          2.4 Update and maintain the schedule, using planning tools.                          2.5 Determine schedule impact of all changes envisaged as part of the Management of Change Process                          2.6 Issue internal reporting / progress measurement                            The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:                              Consistency of planning data                              Planning Engineer shall work under the supervision of the Project Controls Manager, Planning Manager, or in autonomy.                          For specific projects / scope of work / phases, you may be requested to act as the planning representative.

column2: Position Overview : Seeking a highly skilled Planning Engineer to join our dynamic team. The Planning Engineer will be responsible for overseeing project planning, scheduling, resource allocation, and risk management activities to ensure the successful execution of construction projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in civil engineering, a master's degree in construction management, and a proven track record of at least 5 years in building projects.   Key Responsibilities : Planning, tracking and updating the project schedule using project management software such as Primavera P6 or Microsoft Project. Preparation of DPR/WPR/MPR on regular basis. Estimating the resource requirement and prepare mobilization plan in the beginning in coordination with project managers and execution team also Collaboration with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to establish project objectives, timelines, and budgets. Monitor project progress against the schedule and report any delays or deviations to the project team. Support the project team in developing and maintaining project budgets. Ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget. Preparing and tracking procurement schedule. Preparation of delay analysis register and catch-up plan in case of any delay of project expiries.   Must Have skills :  Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field.   Master's degree in Construction Management or equivalent.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in planning and scheduling roles within the construction industry, with a focus on building projects.  Proficiency in project management software, such as Primavera P6, Microsoft Project (MSP), or similar tools. Experience with project risk management and mitigation strategies. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.  Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.  Ability to work as part of a team. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.   Education:  B.E/B.Tech. - Civil + Masters Degree in Construction Management Experience:  Above 05 - 08 Years   Major Experience in Building Projects

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Engineer specializing in contracts to join our team      As a Senior Engineer - Contracts, you will play a critical role in managing and negotiating contracts, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, and mitigating risks associated with contractual agreements      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in engineering, coupled with expertise in contract management and negotiation        Responsibilities:        Contract Management: Oversee the entire lifecycle of contracts, from drafting and negotiation to execution and renewal, ensuring adherence to company policies and legal requirements      Contract Drafting: Draft and review a variety of contracts, including procurement agreements, service contracts, licensing agreements, and subcontractor agreements, incorporating terms and conditions that protect the company's interests and mitigate risks      Contract Negotiation: Lead negotiations with vendors, clients, and subcontractors to achieve favorable contract terms, pricing, and delivery schedules while maintaining positive relationships and ensuring alignment with business objectives      Risk Assessment: Identify and assess legal and commercial risks associated with contractual agreements, proposing risk mitigation strategies and alternative solutions as needed to protect the company's interests      Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards in all contractual transactions, including export controls, intellectual property rights, and data protection regulations      Contract Administration: Maintain accurate contract records, documentation, and databases, tracking key milestones, deadlines, and obligations to facilitate contract management and compliance reporting      Vendor Management: Collaborate with procurement and vendor management teams to evaluate vendor performance, resolve disputes, and enforce contractual obligations, fostering strong and collaborative vendor relationships      Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with internal stakeholders, including legal counsel, finance, engineering, and project management teams, to review contracts, assess business requirements, and address contractual issues and concerns      Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline contract processes, enhance efficiency, and implement best practices in contract management and administration

column2: As a Planning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and managing project schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring the timely and efficient execution of various projects      Your role involves collaborating with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create comprehensive project plans, track progress, and identify potential risks and delays      You will play a crucial role in optimizing project timelines and resource allocation to achieve project objectives within budget and on schedule      Key Responsibilities:Develop detailed project schedules and plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability      Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones      Use project scheduling software (eg, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) to create and maintain project schedules, including critical path analysis      Monitor project progress and compare it with the planned schedule, identifying deviations and potential delays      Analyze resource allocation and workload distribution to ensure efficient utilization of resources      Conduct regular progress meetings with project teams and stakeholders to provide updates on project status and discuss any potential issues      Assess project risks and develop mitigation plans to address potential delays or challenges      Prepare and present periodic reports, dashboards, and analysis of project schedules and performance to senior management      Coordinate with various departments to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities      Review and evaluate project change requests and assess their impact on project schedules      Qualifications and Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field      Proven experience as a Planning Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the construction, engineering, or project management industry      Proficiency in project scheduling software (eg, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and other project management tools      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project timelines and identify potential risks      Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate with project teams and stakeholders      Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously      Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices      Understanding of construction processes and engineering principles is beneficial      Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

column2: Skills           Ms office             MS project             Autocad                     1. Cost Estimation and Budgeting: Prepare accurate cost estimates for construction projects by analyzing project plans, specifications, and other relevant documents. Develop and maintain project budgets throughout the construction process.           2. Quantity Takeoff: Perform detailed quantity takeoffs of materials, labor, and equipment required for construction projects. Collaborate with project managers and other stakeholders to ensure accurate quantity calculations.           3. Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project schedules and timelines using project management software. Identify critical milestones, dependencies, and resource requirements. Regularly update and monitor the project schedule to track progress and ensure timely completion.           4. Progress Monitoring: Monitor the construction projects progress and compare it against the planned schedule. Identify potential delays or issues and propose corrective actions to keep the project on track.           5. Billing and Invoicing: Prepare and review billing statements, invoices, and progress payment applications based on work completed and milestones achieved. Ensure accuracy and compliance with contractual terms and conditions.           6. Cost Control and Variance Analysis: Monitor project costs and expenses, comparing them against the budgeted amounts. Identify cost overruns or savings and provide analysis and recommendations to project stakeholders.           7. Contract Management: Assist in contract administration, including reviewing and interpreting contracts, change order management, and contract compliance. Collaborate with legal and procurement teams to resolve any contractual issues that may arise.           8. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including records of cost estimates, budgets, progress reports, and change orders. Generate regular reports on project status, financial performance, and key metrics for project stakeholders.           9. Coordination and Communication: Collaborate with project managers, engineers, architects, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure effective coordination and communication. Participate in project meetings, provide updates on billing and planning matters, and address any concerns or issues raised by team members.           10. Quality Control: Collaborate with quality control personnel to ensure that construction activities adhere to established standards and specifications. Participate in quality audits and inspections to identify and address any non-compliance issues.           Qualification : BE Civil     ?

column2: Hi We are hiring Project Planning Engineer for US based big MNC Job Location : Bengaluru, Pune, Hyderabad, Chennai, Delhi/NCR, Mumbai Planning and Scheduling Analyzing project requirements and engineering drawings to develop a comprehensive work breakdown structure (WBS) that outlines all project tasks and deliverables. Creating detailed project schedules using scheduling software like Primavera P6 or MS Project, factoring in task dependencies, durations, and resource requirements. Identifying critical path activities within the schedule, which are essential tasks that cannot be delayed without impacting the overall project timeline. Continuously monitoring project progress, identifying and mitigating potential delays, and updating the schedule accordingly. Cost Estimation and Budgeting Preparing detailed cost estimates for labor, materials, equipment, and other project expenses. Developing and managing project budgets, tracking expenditures, and identifying areas for cost savings. Utilizing cost-control measures to ensure projects stay within budget constraints. Resource Management Identifying and securing the necessary resources, such as personnel, equipment, and materials, to complete project tasks on time and within budget. Collaborating with other departments, such as human resources and procurement, to ensure resource availability throughout the project lifecycle. Communication and Collaboration Clearly communicating project plans, schedules, and budgets to all stakeholders, including project managers, engineers, clients, and contractors. Regularly attending project meetings to provide updates, address concerns, and ensure everyone is on the same page. Collaborating effectively with various teams to ensure project tasks are integrated and completed seamlessly. Technical Skills and Knowledge Proficient in project management methodologies and scheduling tools like critical path method (CPM). Understanding of construction principles, engineering practices, and relevant industry standards. Familiarity with cost estimation techniques and software. Strong analytical skills to assess project risks and develop contingency plans. Additional Skills Excellent problem-solving skills to identify and resolve challenges that may arise during project execution. Meticulous attention to detail for accurate planning, scheduling, and cost estimation. Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders.

column2: Purpose of this role: This is a full-time on-site role for a QS and Planning Engineer in Xfinity Buildcon located in Hyderabad. Quantity surveyor is responsible for managing and controlling the costs and contracts involved in a project with expert knowledge in cost estimation, planning, Billing and controlling. Verifies on-site measurement & rates with Project specifications and cost. Checks the quantum of work stated in the bill against actual work done.  A planning engineer is responsible for the planning, scheduling and coordination of construction projects.To work closely with architects, engineers and contractors to ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget. The role involves developing multi-disciplinary conceptual and definitive cost estimates for a variety of projects. Must have previous all-round experience of item rate billing in reputed Construction Companies with thorough ability to work on computers accurately along with proficiency in Auto cad. Candidate must have thorough knowledge of Work Order clauses & its Interpretation, Direct & Indirect Taxation, Scrutiny of Accounts Ledger, Final Bills Settlement & getting Contract Closure documents signed off.  Roles and Responsibilities: Prepare multi-disciplinary cost estimates for a variety of medium and large projects using appropriate systems. Preparation of measurement sheets and assisting in quantity take-off for tenders. To know estimation and costing, Rate analysis, Labor and machinery  analysis which enables to carry out billing works at a different stage of  construction with proper efficiency and accuracy. Prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets and other documentation. Tender management including preparation of bills of quantities, contract conditions and assembly of tender documents. Assist in the estimation of direct costs for tenders. Monitors and records site progress and keep records of day works. Checks the allocation of manpower and productivity. Discuss, coordinate, and resolve estimating input/queries with project team and subject matter experts available in the organization to ensure quality estimate. Ensure all assumptions / clarifications are properly documented. Analysis of Bill claimed by contractors or vendors and closing of the same. Provide support for any selection and optimization study during project development. Support project team in identification, evaluation and capture of capital efficiency opportunities and estimate risks. Perform cost reconciliation to previous estimates as project develops. Perform complete analysis and cost validations using internal and  external benchmarking data, historical indices, and component benchmarking. Mentor & supports the review of the estimates prepared by other cost engineers to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with scope of work. Prepare claims in coordination with the Project Manager / Director. Follow-up payments. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget and to the required standards. Qualifications   Degree in B.E / B.Tech in Civil Engineering or Construction Management from a recognised industry. 5+ years of experience in QS and planning engineer role. Experience in quantity surveying, cost analysis, and project planning Proficiency in using project management software A proven track record in handling residential high-rise Buildings, Commercial and Industrial buildings. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent written and oral communication skills and teamwork abilities Knowledge of relevant industry regulations and best practices Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines Preferred Candidate Profile Preferred candidate from Hyderabad only. Preferred Construction background

column2: Job   Description Planning   Executive   -   Irrigation   Project Profile Summary : A Planning Executive in a construction company holds a critical position responsible for orchestrating various aspects of project planning, coordination, and execution. Their key responsibilities include developing comprehensive project plans, efficiently allocating resources, managing project schedules, mitigating risks, controlling budgets, ensuring quality standards, maintaining regulatory compliance, facilitating communication among stakeholders, generating progress reports, and driving continuous improvement initiatives. By effectively fulfilling these duties, Planning Executives play a crucial role in ensuring that construction projects are completed successfully, on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of clients and stakeholders. Responsibilities: 1. Assist in developing and maintaining project plans and schedules for the irrigation project,  including activity sequencing, resource allocation, and critical path analysis, utilizing project  management software and tools. 2. Support the Planning Manager and Planning Officers in gathering input from project teams,  subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure accurate and realistic project schedules that align with  project objectives and constraints. 3. Monitor project progress against established schedules, track key milestones, and report  deviations or delays to the Planning Manager for timely intervention and corrective action. 4. Participate in progress meetings with project teams to review schedule performance, identify  potential issues or risks, and contribute ideas for problem-solving and optimization. 5. Collaborate with procurement and logistics teams to facilitate the timely procurement and  delivery of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities, ensuring  alignment with project schedules. 6. Assist in analyzing project data and performance metrics to identify trends, areas for  improvement, and opportunities to optimize resource utilization and project efficiency. 7. Support the identification, assessment, and mitigation of potential risks and uncertainties that  may impact project schedule or budget, under the guidance of the Planning Manager. 8. Provide regular reports and updates on project schedule performance, including progress  against milestones, critical path analysis, and forecasted completion dates, to project  stakeholders and management. 9. Assist project managers in resolving scheduling conflicts, resource constraints, and other issues  that may arise during project execution, demonstrating effective communication and problem-  solving skills. 10. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and quality standards throughout the  project planning and execution phases, with a focus on safety, quality, and environmental  sustainability.   Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in BE in civil engineering. 2. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. 3. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. 5. Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. 6. Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. 7. Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget. Project   details: 1. Company Headquarter: Nagpur 2. Company: Infratech Construction Company 3. Project Name: Jigaon Project 4. Site location: Tal. Nandura, Dist.Buldana. Construction of Earthen Dam including spillway stilling basin, divide wall approach road, tail channel of Jigaon Project.

column2: This is the perfect place to work if you are passionate about technology and want an opportunity to use your creativity to help grow and scale a global range of IT systems, Infrastructure and IT Services. Our cutting-edge technology allows us to stream sports content to millions of concurrent viewers globally across multiple platforms and devices. DAZN?? Cloud based architecture unifies a range of technologies in order to deliver a seamless user experience and support a global user base and company infrastructure.    This role will be based in our brand-new Hyderabad office. Join us in India?? beautiful ??ity of Pearls??and bring your ambition to life.     How do you fancy being able to influence a product that is used by millions of users globally across multiple devices daily??DAZN is a rapidly scaling media streaming global platform, offering the most comprehensive selection of live and on-demand sports content and original programming available anywhere in the world.   Role Overview   As the Planning Co-ordinator in the Central Planning Team, you will play a key role in the operation of DAZN?? global live and non-live event planning. We are looking for a talented, diligent candidate with a strong attention to detail and organisational skills. You will help to manage the events we schedule onto our platform, working with regional editorial, production and operational teams to ensure that all factors relating to our broadcast output are considered. You will play a pivotal role in determining what content is played out to our subscriber base.?   Responsibilities & Requirements   Working on a 24/7 shift rota basis, manage the planning of all live and non-live content that appears on the platform from multiple broadcast partners. Ensure that accurate event information is entered into the MediaGenix WhatsON broadcast management system. Proactively manage schedule changes. Act as key operational liaison between Central Planning, Production and Broadcast Operations teams to help implement content strategy Act as key point of contact communicating DAZN schedule information to wider business units and external partners. Attend weekly and monthly planning meetings with local and central teams. Assist in ad hoc project work with the Central team Learn and maintain a strong understanding of DAZN KPIs.   Essential Skills & Experience   Exceptional organisational and time management skills. Strong attention to detail. Ability to work both as part of a team and individually. Ability to adapt to changing business needs, cultures, conditions and work responsibilities Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines. Flexibility, proactivity, and resilience         Even Better to have   ? Knowledge of, or strong interest in, broadcast workflows, formats and operating systems. Excellent knowledge of, or willingness to research and learn, sport competition formats Strong Microsoft Office product skills, notably Microsoft Excel  At DAZN, we bring ambition to life. We are innovators, game-changers and pioneers. So, if you want to push boundaries and make an impact, DAZN is the place to be.?    As part of our team,you'll have the opportunity to make your mark and the power to make change happen. We're doing things no-one has done before, giving fans and customers access to sport anytime, anywhere. We're using world-class technology to transform sports and revolutionise the industry and we're not going to stop.?  ?   DAZN VALUES ??THE ??OW??IN WHAT WE DO:? ?  ?   AMBITIOUS ??people who want to make a big impact and drive DAZN forward.?   ?   INVENTIVE ??people with bright ideas who deliver great new experiences for our customers ??and improvements for our business.? People who come up with better, simpler ways of doing things. ?  ?   PASSIONATE ??people who are proud of our product, our content and our business ??and love to shout about it.? People who love what they do and show commitment every day. ?  ?   BRAVE ??people who take difficult decisions to help us focus on improving DAZN, our performance and our results.?   ?   SUPPORTIVE ??people who know that we achieve more as a team than as individuals.? People value inclusion and look out for each other, helping their colleagues enjoy their work and develop their careers.? People who consider others before making decisions. ?    At DAZN, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment that values equality and diversity, where everyone can contribute and have their voices heard. This means hiring and developing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, age groups, sexual orientations, gender identities and abilities.?    Everyone has the opportunity to make change and impact our DEI journey by joining our ERGs: Proud@DAZN, Women@DAZN, Disability@DAZN and ParentZone.  ?  If you?? like to include a cover letter with your application, please feel free to. Please do not feel you need to apply with a photo or disclose any other information that is not related to your professional experience.  ?  Our aim is to make our hiring processes as accessible for everyone as possible, including providing adjustments for interviews where we can.  ?  We look forward to hearing from you.

column2: Job   Description: Planning   Manager   -   Irrigation   Project Profile   Summary:  As a Planning Manager for Irrigation Projects, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the effective planning, coordination, and execution of irrigation construction projects. Your primary responsibility will be to develop comprehensive project plans, schedules, and strategies to optimize resource utilization and ensure timely completion of projects. You will work closely with project teams, stakeholders, and subcontractors to oversee all aspects of project planning and ensure alignment with client requirements and industry standards. Responsibilities: 1. Strategic Planning: ??Develop detailed project plans and schedules for irrigation construction projects, considering project scope, timelines, resource requirements, and budget constraints. ??Conduct feasibility studies, risk assessments, and site evaluations to identify potential challenges and develop mitigation strategies. 2. Resource Allocation: ??Coordinate with project managers, engineers, and procurement teams to allocate  resources (including manpower, equipment, and materials) effectively across irrigation  projects. ??Monitor resource utilization and adjust plans as needed to optimize productivity and minimize costs. 3. Schedule Management: ??Create and maintain project schedules, outlining key milestones, tasks, and dependencies for irrigation construction activities. ??Monitor project progress against schedules, identify delays or deviations, and implement corrective actions to ensure adherence to timelines. 4. Stakeholder Communication: ??Serve as the primary point of contact for project planning-related inquiries from internal teams, clients, regulatory authorities, and community stakeholders. ??Facilitate regular meetings and progress updates to communicate project status, address concerns, and solicit feedback. 5. Performance Analysis: ??Implement performance measurement systems to track project progress, analyze data, and generate reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) for irrigation projects. ??Identify trends, areas for improvement, and lessons learned to inform future planning activities and enhance project efficiency. 6. Compliance and Quality Assurance: ??Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, codes, and standards governing irrigation construction projects. ??Implement quality assurance processes to maintain high standards of workmanship and deliverables. 7. Continuous Improvement: ??Lead initiatives to streamline planning processes, enhance efficiency, and incorporate best practices into irrigation project planning and execution. ??Stay updated on industry trends, technological advancements, and emerging practices related to irrigation construction. 8. Team Leadership: ??Provide leadership and guidance to planning engineers, coordinators, and project teams, fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment. ??Mentor team members, conduct performance evaluations, and identify opportunities for professional development. Requirements: ??Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering. ??Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. ??Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. ??Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. ??Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. ??Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. ??Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget.   Project   details: ??Company Headquarter:  Nagpur ??Company:  Infratech   Construction   Company ??Project Name:  Jigaon   Project ??Site location:  Tal.   Nandura,   Dist.Buldana. column2: *    Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans, including schedules, timelines, and resource allocation. Coordinate with various teams to gather project requirements and ensure alignment with project goals. Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. Monitor project progress and adjust plans as necessary to meet changing requirements. Quantity Surveying: Prepare accurate quantity take-offs and cost estimates for materials, labor, and equipment. Evaluate subcontractor and vendor bids to ensure competitiveness and compliance with project requirements. Monitor project costs and expenditures to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints. Prepare and submit progress payment claims and variations as required. Cost Control: Implement effective cost control measures to minimize project expenses and maximize profitability. Contract Management: Review and negotiate contracts with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders. Ensure compliance with contract terms and conditions, including quality standards and delivery schedules. Resolve any contractual disputes or issues in a timely and efficient manner. Team Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to the planning and QS team members. Foster a collaborative and positive work environment to enhance team performance. Conduct regular performance reviews and provide feedback to team members to support their professional development. Proven experience in project planning and quantity surveying, with a minimum of 12 in a similar role, preferably within the highway construction industry. Strong knowledge of project management methodologies, cost control techniques, and contract administration. Proficiency in project management software and tools, such as Primavera P6, MS Project, and Excel. Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail. Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders at all levels. Professional certifications such as MRICS, PMP, or similar are desirable. Note: Mandatory experience of 10-13 years in Roads Project.

column2: Key Accountabilities   Pre-Construction Planning Integrated micro level planning & scheduling of multi discipline activities viz. - Liaison, Design, Pre-Construction activities, Marketing & Sales etc. Creating multiphase plans for the projects. Reviewing & tracking the approved schedule until project launch & start of construction activities. Reviewing weekly & monthly progress MIS reports for review. Identifying Pre-Construction project risk, creating mitigation plans, risk triggers & monitoring the same. Raising flag on regular basis to enable informed decision making for management on all delays. Proficiency in creating plans in the latest ERP software viz. ASTA, MSP etc. to integrate with ERP Project Management module. Construction Planning Creating & integrating construction plan for execution, incorporating multi decision activities. Work Break Down structure and activity level planning with integrated labor and cash flow planning. Generating work progress Curve, Cash Flow Curve and reviewing qualitative comparative analysis for review. Generating various progress & analytical reports enabling brisk decision making for on- course corrective measures. Performing weekly review and communicating critical actions to the Projects Execution team. Coordinate with the on-site Project team for conducting review meetings involving contractors, consultants, etc. Coordinate with Liaison Team to ensure uninterrupted Construction at site by obtaining all necessary statutory stage wise approvals including the Occupation/Completion Certificates Delay analysis and incorporating learning in the future progress. Creating Recovery plan by crashing activities & planning for resource optimization. Providing inputs to the Execution, Procurement and Finance/Accounts team for the respective function. Costing and Budgeting Ensure accurate estimation & costing of present and future projects. Prepare cost-review statements of various projects. Analyze project requirements, project feasibility data, contingencies etc. Prepare consolidated budget for the project and obtain the approval of top management  Cost Planning - Reviewing preliminary budget estimate based on the Concept / schematic drawings / Views etc. Coordinate with Procurement/ Contracts, Design, and on-site Teams for drawings, details of contract awarded and rates of various line items. Monitor detailed cost estimates of the project & review periodically. Make comparative cost statements for projects. Prepare cost review statements, reconciliation & cash flow statements. Suggest various cost-saving measures with respect to design, material or services. Monitor all material consumption and contracts in ERP. Monitor costs & progress through regular site visits and co-ordination with Contracts Team. Ensure rates in the WO & PO are within budget/estimate. Monitor timely generation of budget vs actuals reports on a monthly basis. Verify total project expenditure report at the end of the project to determine total project cost. Guide team members in costing & budgeting to ensure cost incurred until date and cost to complete statements generated as and when required. Institute a standard operating process. Identify processes/procedures in own work area that need improvement. Recommend process improvement ideas to streamline efficiency/costs/productivity  Undertake process improvement activities in own work area. Value Engineering Conduct Technical Due Diligence for the project during its design evolution phase. Ensuring that the Value of the product is either enhanced or maintained at reduced cost by conducting a structured Value Engineering exercise. Coordinate with Design team & all respective consultants to ensure that the product is designed for optimization. Capture the learning from Value Engineering (VE) exercise and implement in the upcoming projects. Use VE principles in Structural engineering, MEP, Infrastructure works & Architectural specifications. Project Management Evaluate various construction methodologies, technology and adopt, implement the most appropriate solution for the project in coordination with the Project Team. Conduct appropriate Buildability studies to ensure smooth and efficient construction. Prepare Risk register and maintain it to address project level risk. Evaluate the right execution strategy for phase wise development integrating the stages of statutory approvals, launch plan, cash flow requirement and business needs. Gather relevant data required for planning from Project In-charge. Provide accurate data to prepare BMCP (Baseline Master Construction Planning. Monitoring project progress each activity in line with BMCP/PMP. Assist in detailing WBS (Work Breakdown Schedule). Update BMCP in ERP and track progress of the project on real time basis. Update any changes in BMCP immediately in BMCP. Report any deviation from BMCP to Director Projects. Update and feed approved plan schedule and budget in ERP (WBS Provide relevant and accurate data for MIS reports/meetings  Desired Candidate Profile    BE(Civil) /NICMAR(PGPMP) would be an added advantage   Experience in Real Estate (Residential & Commercial) preferred  5-12 years' relevant experience of related work in planning and scheduling both engineering and construction activities is required.  Candidate should have Residential & Commercial work experience. Local candidates with Gujarati Speaking will be given preference.  Perks and Benefits     Salary and Benefits will be commensurate with qualifications & experience and will not be a limiting factor for deserving candidates.

column2: Complete Construction Project Planning Processes Most construction projects start with a civil project manager. These professionals review land surveys, assess project estimations and budgets, inspect existing structures, create design plans, and review potential safety issues. Oversee Construction Personnel Civil project managers often manage on-site construction crews. They are responsible for negotiating the contracts of subcontractors, communicating with inspectors and architects, meeting with construction managers, and coordinating the delivery of materials with vendors. Prepare Progress Reports and Attend Meetings It is typically up to civil project managers to generate reports focusing on project progress, job status, and costs. They usually attend weekly or biweekly meetings to present progress information to superiors.
column11: Project Management, Project Manager Civil, Construction Project Planning, construction, Project Planning

column2: As a Planning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and managing project schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring the timely and efficient execution of various projects     Your role involves collaborating with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create comprehensive project plans, track progress, and identify potential risks and delays     You will play a crucial role in optimizing project timelines and resource allocation to achieve project objectives within budget and on schedule       Key Responsibilities:       Develop detailed project schedules and plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability     Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones     Use project scheduling software (e g, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) to create and maintain project schedules, including critical path analysis     Monitor project progress and compare it with the planned schedule, identifying deviations and potential delays     Analyze resource allocation and workload distribution to ensure efficient utilization of resources     Conduct regular progress meetings with project teams and stakeholders to provide updates on project status and discuss any potential issues     Assess project risks and develop mitigation plans to address potential delays or challenges     Prepare and present periodic reports, dashboards, and analysis of project schedules and performance to senior management     Coordinate with various departments to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities     Review and evaluate project change requests and assess their impact on project schedules       Qualifications and Requirements:       Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field     Proven experience as a Planning Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the construction, engineering, or project management industry     Proficiency in project scheduling software (e g, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and other project management tools     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project timelines and identify potential risks     Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate with project teams and stakeholders     Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously     Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices     Understanding of construction processes and engineering principles is beneficial     Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
column11: Electrical engineering, Civil, Transmission, Project planning, Scheduling

column2: Project Planning and Scheduling:Collaborate with project managers to create detailed project plans outlining tasks, timelines, and resources required     Develop and maintain project schedules, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives     Monitor project progress and identify potential issues or delays     Take proactive measures to mitigate risks and keep the project on track     Resource Management:Coordinate with various departments to allocate necessary resources, including team members, equipment, and materials     Track resource availability and utilization to optimize project efficiency     Assist in resolving resource conflicts and bottlenecks     Communication and Collaboration:Facilitate effective communication between project team members, stakeholders, and management     Organize regular project meetings, prepare agendas, and document meeting minutes     Act as a liaison between different departments involved in the project, ensuring seamless collaboration and information flow     Documentation and Reporting:Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including plans, schedules, progress reports, and project-related correspondence     Generate and distribute regular project status reports to stakeholders     Keep project documentation up-to-date and organized for future reference     Quality Assurance:Ensure that project activities are conducted in accordance with established quality standards and procedures     Monitor the quality of work and implement corrective actions when necessary     Issue Resolution:Identify project issues and challenges and work with the project team to develop solutions     Escalate critical issues to project managers and assist in finding resolution strategies     Qualifications:Bachelors degree in business administration, project management, or a related field     Proven experience in project coordination or a similar role     Strong organizational skills and attention to detail     Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities     Proficient in project management software tools     Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines     Knowledge of project management methodologies (e     g     , Agile, Scrum) is a plus     Preferred Skills:Certification in project management (e     g     , PMP, PRINCE2) is desirable     Familiarity with industry-specific project requirements     Problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude     Ability to adapt to changing priorities and requirements

column2: Job Summary: We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Planning manager to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinate and supervise a variety of projects, monitor a department or project's budget, inventory, and production schedule helps to build a roadmap to achieve the goals of the organization and directs all activities towards that course of action. Responsibilities: Preparing planning and new housing proposals in line with company strategy. Obtaining planning consent for proposals. Liaising with the planning team on the development of new site proposals. Keeping up to date with planning regulations, policy and legislation. Preparing supporting documentation for proposals including key data related to projects: land use, occupancy rates, infrastructure support, demographic and costing facts and figures. Attending and presenting at proposal meetings, planning consent boards, appeal panels and public inquiries. Preparing budgets and overseeing the financial administration of planning projects. Communicating with key stakeholders involved in the project including external and government agencies. Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility Ensure resource availability and allocation Develop a detailed project plan to track progress Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques Report and escalate to management as needed, perform risk management to minimize project risks Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendor, Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation. Preparation of Budget and Tracking the actual expenses, Preparation of Weekly MIS for Ongoing site, ensure empanelment of various Consultants as required. Coordinate internally with all concerned teams for concerned projects (Budgeting, Tendering & Contracts, Billing, Liaison, Legal, Architecture, Site), Coordinate with external consultants, Prepare weekly Project updates for management review Jointly Prepare and sign off on the corrective action steps with Project Manager. Ensure that the agreed corrective action/ steps are executed on site. Ensure the project is run as per timelines without compromising on the quality and cost at any stage. Conducting Review Meetings at Regular intervals; Preparing & circulating Minutes of the Meeting. Review and expedite the targets as prescribed in the Minutes of the Meeting. Studying and Analysing the MIS and then reporting it to the Project Director. Maintaining all project related Information in soft copy format which includes drawings, Calculations, Municipal approvals and other such documents in soft copy format for necessary submissions to the Project Director, if required. To be the single point of contact for all details related to the project (s) handled both for the internal and external agencies including compliances. Key skills Outstanding research skills together with an in-depth knowledge project planning process. Analytical ability to understand and interpret data for a range of audiences. Exemplary administration skills with an ability to make sound and appropriate judgements and problem solving at each stage of the planning process. Solid project management skills with an ability to be flexible when required. Strong numeracy skills with some experience of managing complex budgets. An ability to priorities workloads and juggle competing demands. Multi-tasking. Good listening skills with an aptitude for superior written and verbal communications. Faultless planning skills including deep understanding of the planning consent process. Client facing competencies with the ability to present and communicate at senior levels and across a range of stakeholders. Keen knowledge and expertise of planning practice legislation across England and Wales. Problem solving flair with creative skillfulness. Experienced in using planning software and data systems. Good interpersonal skills and a team player. Relevant experience BE Civil/ Post Graduation in construction Management or similar specialization and must have work experience relevant role. Five to 10 years proven experience in planning. Computer literacy (MS Office applications, in particular), Excellent organizational skills, with an ability to prioritize important projects. Should have good Communication and Interaction skills and negotiation skills. Extensive experience of the planning process from preparation and submission to consent and appeal. Evidence of previous report writing and making recommendations on major planning applications. Analytical track record for using and translating data for proposal planning purposes. Experienced in planning laws and related legislation. Project management know-how with previous experience of taking planning projects through the stages from formation to finalisation. Skilful in planning and software computer programmes.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Project Planning:  Lead the planning phase of real estate development projects, defining objectives, scopes, and timelines in alignment with organizational goals and client requirements. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure adherence to local zoning regulations, building codes, environmental standards, and other legal requirements throughout the planning process, obtaining necessary permits and approvals as needed. Team Coordination:  Collaborate closely with architects, urban designers, surveyors, environmental specialists, and other stakeholders to integrate diverse perspectives and expertise into project planning and design. Design Optimization:  Review and refine design proposals to enhance functionality, sustainability, and aesthetic appeal while maintaining cost-effectiveness and feasibility. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and challenges associated with project planning and propose mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions and ensure project success. Budget and Schedule Management:  Develop and monitor project budgets and schedules, identifying opportunities for cost savings and efficiency improvements while maintaining quality standards and timelines. Stakeholder Communication:  Communicate project progress, challenges, and recommendations effectively to internal teams, clients, regulatory authorities, and other stakeholders through reports, presentations, and meetings. Continuous Improvement:  Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in real estate development and planning, contributing to the continuous improvement of processes and methodologies within the organization.

column2: Job Overview We are actively seeking an experienced Quantity Surveyor & Quality Control Engineer with minimum 10 years of expertise in the Rele State/construction industry. The ideal candidate should possess advanced billing skills, including the preparation of client bills, subcontractor bill verification, and proficiency in key software. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Billing Expertise:  Demonstrate proficiency in abstracts of cost, abstracts of quantity, measurement sheets, BOQ sheets MOP, NGL sheets, material reconciliation, price variation, BBS, and amendment of quantity for accurate and timely client billing. 2.  Contractor Billing:  Thoroughly check and prepare subcontractor bills, ensuring precision and compliance with project specifications. 3.  Tender Analysis:  Read and interpret tender documents and item specifications to prepare comprehensive bills. 4.  Quantity and Price Management:  Handle quantity variations, price variations, and extra item preparation with supporting documentation. 5.  Work Order Amendments:  Manage the amendment of work orders efficiently, providing necessary details for clarity. 6.  Abstracts and Final Payment:  Develop abstracts of quantity and cost, and finalize the method of payment in collaboration with project stakeholders. 7.  Inspection:  Inspect construction sites thoroughly to make sure they meet quality standards. Report any problems or differences from the standards quickly. 8.  Testing and Analysis:  Test construction materials to check their quality and strength. 9. Look at the test results and work with the construction team to fix any issues. 10.  Documentation:  Keep detailed records of inspections, tests, and quality control work. Create reports that show what you find and suggest what should be done. 11.  Collaboration:  Work closely with project managers, architects, and contractors to fix quality problems. Help and train construction teams on how to keep up the quality.   Requirements/Qualifications: Gender: Male Desired Candidate Profile: BE/ B.Tech Civil Engineering. column2: As a Planning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and managing project schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring the timely and efficient execution of various projects     Your role involves collaborating with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create comprehensive project plans, track progress, and identify potential risks and delays     You will play a crucial role in optimizing project timelines and resource allocation to achieve project objectives within budget and on schedule       Key Responsibilities:       Develop detailed project schedules and plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability     Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones     Use project scheduling software (e g, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) to create and maintain project schedules, including critical path analysis     Monitor project progress and compare it with the planned schedule, identifying deviations and potential delays     Analyze resource allocation and workload distribution to ensure efficient utilization of resources     Conduct regular progress meetings with project teams and stakeholders to provide updates on project status and discuss any potential issues     Assess project risks and develop mitigation plans to address potential delays or challenges     Prepare and present periodic reports, dashboards, and analysis of project schedules and performance to senior management     Coordinate with various departments to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities     Review and evaluate project change requests and assess their impact on project schedules       Qualifications and Requirements:       Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field     Proven experience as a Planning Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the construction, engineering, or project management industry     Proficiency in project scheduling software (e g, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and other project management tools     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project timelines and identify potential risks     Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate with project teams and stakeholders     Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously     Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices     Understanding of construction processes and engineering principles is beneficial     Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

Subcontractor Billing : Handle billing for subcontractors involved in the project, ensuring that their work is accurately accounted for. Material Reconciliation : Monitor and reconcile materials used on-site to ensure efficient resource utilization. Budget of Project : Assist in creating and managing the project budget, tracking expenses, and ensuring cost control. Preparation of BBS (Bar Bending Schedule) : Create BBS to specify the quantities of steel reinforcement required for the construction project. Experience : A minimum of 3-6 years of experience in Quantity Surveying and Billing for residential/commercial projects within a contracting firm. Skills : Proficient in quantity surveying, BBS preparation, and rate analysis. Good communication skills and proficiency in AutoCAD and MS Office. Knowledge of an ERP system would be advantageous. Personality : Smart and active personality to effectively interact with clients and handle QS/Billing responsibilities at the construction site.   How to Apply: Interested candidates can apply through the following methods: Apply through the naukri portal. Send their CV to the provided email addresses: strongbuilt.hr@skywaygroup.co.in abhijit.mitra@skywaygroup.co.in ashifkhan@skywaygroup.co.in Candidates should ensure that their applications highlight their relevant experience and skills related to quantity surveying and billing for construction projects.

column2: Hi We are hiring Billing Engineer for US based big EPC Company Job Location : Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad, Pune, Mumbai, Delhi/NCR Billing engineers ensure the financial accuracy and efficiency of projects by handling various tasks related to invoices and payments. Their responsibilities can be categorized into three main areas: processing bills, maintaining project budgets, and communication and collaboration. Processing Bills Reviewing and verifying invoices submitted by vendors and contractors for completeness and accuracy according to contracts and project specifications. Preparing and issuing invoices to clients based on project milestones, deliverables, and agreed-upon rates. Tracking project expenses and ensuring they stay within budget limitations. Managing discrepancies and resolving billing issues with vendors and clients. Maintaining Project Budgets Analyzing project data and costs to identify potential budget overruns. Working with project managers and other teams to implement cost-saving measures when necessary. Preparing cost estimates and justifications for billing purposes. Maintaining detailed records of all billing-related activities and documentation for future reference. Communication and Collaboration Coordinating with internal teams like project managers, engineers, and accounting departments to ensure accurate and timely billing processes. Communicating effectively with clients to answer billing inquiries, address concerns, and provide explanations regarding invoices. Liaising with vendors and contractors to clarify billing details and resolve any discrepancies. Additional Skills for Billing Engineers Proficiency in billing software and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. Strong understanding of contract terms and pricing models. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve billing issues. Meticulous attention to detail for accurate financial recordkeeping. Effective communication and interpersonal skills for clear and professional interactions with various stakeholders.

column2: Purpose of this role: This is a full-time on-site role for a QS and Planning Engineer in Xfinity Buildcon located in Hyderabad. Quantity surveyor is responsible for managing and controlling the costs and contracts involved in a project with expert knowledge in cost estimation, planning, Billing and controlling. Verifies on-site measurement & rates with Project specifications and cost. Checks the quantum of work stated in the bill against actual work done.  A planning engineer is responsible for the planning, scheduling and coordination of construction projects.To work closely with architects, engineers and contractors to ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget. The role involves developing multi-disciplinary conceptual and definitive cost estimates for a variety of projects. Must have previous all-round experience of item rate billing in reputed Construction Companies with thorough ability to work on computers accurately along with proficiency in Auto cad. Candidate must have thorough knowledge of Work Order clauses & its Interpretation, Direct & Indirect Taxation, Scrutiny of Accounts Ledger, Final Bills Settlement & getting Contract Closure documents signed off.  Roles and Responsibilities: Prepare multi-disciplinary cost estimates for a variety of medium and large projects using appropriate systems. Preparation of measurement sheets and assisting in quantity take-off for tenders. To know estimation and costing, Rate analysis, Labor and machinery  analysis which enables to carry out billing works at a different stage of  construction with proper efficiency and accuracy. Prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets and other documentation. Tender management including preparation of bills of quantities, contract conditions and assembly of tender documents. Assist in the estimation of direct costs for tenders. Monitors and records site progress and keep records of day works. Checks the allocation of manpower and productivity. Discuss, coordinate, and resolve estimating input/queries with project team and subject matter experts available in the organization to ensure quality estimate. Ensure all assumptions / clarifications are properly documented. Analysis of Bill claimed by contractors or vendors and closing of the same. Provide support for any selection and optimization study during project development. Support project team in identification, evaluation and capture of capital efficiency opportunities and estimate risks. Perform cost reconciliation to previous estimates as project develops. Perform complete analysis and cost validations using internal and  external benchmarking data, historical indices, and component benchmarking. Mentor & supports the review of the estimates prepared by other cost engineers to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with scope of work. Prepare claims in coordination with the Project Manager / Director. Follow-up payments. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget and to the required standards. Qualifications   Degree in B.E / B.Tech in Civil Engineering or Construction Management from a recognised industry. 5+ years of experience in QS and planning engineer role. Experience in quantity surveying, cost analysis, and project planning Proficiency in using project management software A proven track record in handling residential high-rise Buildings, Commercial and Industrial buildings. plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability      Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones column2: Skills           Ms office             MS project             Autocad                     1. Cost Estimation and Budgeting: Prepare accurate cost estimates for construction projects by analyzing project plans, specifications, and other relevant documents. Develop and maintain project budgets throughout the construction process.           2. Quantity Takeoff: Perform detailed quantity takeoffs of materials, labor, and equipment required for construction projects. Collaborate with project managers and other stakeholders to ensure accurate quantity calculations.           3. Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project schedules and timelines using project management software. Identify critical milestones, dependencies, and resource requirements. Regularly update and monitor the project schedule to track progress and ensure timely completion.           4. Progress Monitoring: Monitor the construction projects progress and compare it against the planned schedule. Identify potential delays or issues and propose corrective actions to keep the project on track.           5. Billing and Invoicing: Prepare and review billing statements, invoices, and progress payment applications based on work completed and milestones achieved. Ensure accuracy and compliance with contractual terms and conditions.           6. Cost Control and Variance Analysis: Monitor project costs and expenses, comparing them against the budgeted amounts. Identify cost overruns or savings and provide analysis and recommendations to project stakeholders.           7. Contract Management: Assist in contract administration, including reviewing and interpreting contracts, change order management, and contract compliance. Collaborate with legal and procurement teams to resolve any contractual issues that may arise.           8. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including records of cost estimates, budgets, progress reports, and change orders. Generate regular reports on project status, financial performance, and key metrics for project stakeholders.           9. Coordination and Communication: Collaborate with project managers, engineers, architects, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure effective coordination and communication. Participate in project meetings, provide updates on billing and planning matters, and address any concerns or issues raised by team members.           10. Quality Control: Collaborate with quality control personnel to ensure that construction activities adhere to established standards and specifications. Participate in quality audits and inspections to identify and address any non-compliance issues.           Qualification : BE Civil     ?

column2: Role & responsibilities     Greetings from Usha Construction!! We have an urgent opening for the position of   Senior Quality Surveyor/biling Engineer  &  Assistant Quality Engineer/ Biling Engineer  ( @  Bangalore  & Ernakulam ).   As a Quantity Surveyor in the Construction industry, you will play a crucial role in managing the financial aspects of construction and development projects. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that construction projects are executed within budget and cost-effective, while maintaining quality standards. You will be responsible for accurately estimating project costs, preparing budgets, analyzing expenses, and monitoring progress throughout the project lifecycle.     .   Roles and Responsibilities       Senior Quality Surveyor/biling Engineer  &  Assistant Quality Engineer/ Biling Engineer.- .Job Responsibilities Include:     Collaborate with the project team to accurately estimate the costs of materials, labor, and equipment required for the construction project : Monitor project expenses regularly to ensure adherence to      the budget. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement appropriate      measures to control expenditure. : Review and negotiate contracts with suppliers and subcontractors to establish favorable terms and conditions for the project : Prepare detailed budgets based on the cost estimates and project requirements,Bar Bending Schedule, taking into account all necessary factors such as contingencies and inflation. : Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and      industry standards. Prepare and present regular reports on project costs,      progress, and financial status to stakeholders. : Identify potential risks and advise the project team on      measures to mitigate cost-related risks. Conduct post-construction evaluations to assess the actual      costs against the budget and identify areas for improvement in future      projects. Valuation and Payment: Prepare interim and final valuations      for the work done by contractors and subcontractors, and facilitate      payment processes in accordance with contractual terms. Prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets, bills of quantities and other documentation Track changes to the design and/or construction work and adjust budget projections accordingly Procure or agree the services of contractors and/or subcontractors who work on the construction of the project Measure and value the work done on site Liaise with the client and other construction professionals, such as site managers, project managers and site engineers Write MIS reports. Preparing RA bills ,BBS Preparing reconciliation of construction materials. Co-ordination with Site Incharges and update the same with MD Preparing rate analysis and BOQ Bill and cash flow inspection prepared by junior technical staffs.  Planning for day today activities and procuring all the resources needed.    Skill Required     Budgeting skills Mathematical skills Problem-solving skills Good financial skills Logical and thinking ability skills Communication skills Negotiation and team-building skills Organizational and planning skills Leadership skills   Preferred candidate profile     Qualification / Experience Required: Bachelor's degree-B. tech -B.E/ Diploma in Building Construction, Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or Architecture etc. 4 to 10 years of experience as Senior Quantity Surveyor  &  2 to 4 years of Experience as Assitant QS /Billing Engineer within construction. Previous working experience in Government project would be an added advantage. Comfortable designing and Planning blueprints and drawings Proficient in Microsoft Office and general computer software Prepare tender documents, contracts, budgets, bills of quantities and other documentation. Ability to budget, schedule, negotiate, and control costs High degree of familiarity with contract and subcontract documents, terms, and conditions Strong leadership and management skills Perks and benefits

negotiating contracts, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, and mitigating risks associated with contractual agreements      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in engineering, coupled with expertise in contract management and negotiation        Responsibilities:        Contract Management: Oversee the entire lifecycle of contracts, from drafting and negotiation to execution and renewal, ensuring adherence to company policies and legal requirements      Contract Drafting: Draft and review a variety of contracts, including procurement agreements, service contracts, licensing agreements, and subcontractor agreements, incorporating terms and conditions that protect the company's interests and mitigate risks      Contract Negotiation: Lead negotiations with vendors, clients, and subcontractors to achieve favorable contract terms, pricing, and delivery schedules while maintaining positive relationships and ensuring alignment with business objectives company's interests      Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards in all contractual transactions, including export controls, intellectual property rights, and data protection regulations      Contract Administration: Maintain accurate contract records, documentation, and databases, tracking key milestones, deadlines, and obligations to facilitate contract management and compliance reporting      Vendor Management: Collaborate with procurement and vendor management teams to evaluate vendor performance, resolve disputes, and enforce contractual obligations, fostering strong and collaborative vendor relationships      Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with internal stakeholders, including legal counsel, finance, engineering, and project management teams, to review contracts, assess business requirements, and address contractual issues and concerns      Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline contract processes, enhance efficiency, and implement best practices in contract management and administration
