column2: Ford Global Business Services is looking for Capacity & Constraints analyst to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        Capacity Planning: Analyze and forecast the capacity needs of various resources such as production lines, equipment, facilities, or workforce to meet demand      Identifying Constraints: Identify bottlenecks or constraints within the operational processes that hinder productivity or limit output      Resource Allocation: Optimize resource allocation by balancing capacity with demand, ensuring resources are utilized effectively to meet business objectives      Performance Analysis: Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to capacity utilization, throughput, and efficiency      Constraint Mitigation: Develop strategies to alleviate constraints, such as process redesign, workflow optimization, or resource reallocation      Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, production, supply chain, and management to align capacity planning with organizational goals      Data Analysis: Utilize statistical and analytical tools to interpret data, identify patterns, and make data-driven decisions to address constraints      Continuous Improvement: Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance capacity management processes and optimize resource utilization      Skills and Qualifications:Analytical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis, statistical analysis, and modeling to assess capacity and constraints      Problem-solving: Ability to identify operational constraints, analyze root causes, and devise effective solutions      Capacity Planning Knowledge: Understanding of capacity planning methodologies, production scheduling, and resource optimization      Communication: Strong communication skills to collaborate with various teams, convey findings, and propose recommendations      Project Management: Ability to manage projects related to capacity planning, constraints analysis, and process improvement

column2: Job Overview-   The Project Planning Engineer is responsible for creating and managing project schedules, tracking progress, and identifying potential issues that may affect the timely completion of a project. This role involves collaboration with various teams, including project managers, engineers, and stakeholders, to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the project lifecycle.  Role & responsibilities     Schedule Development:  - Create detailed project schedules based on project requirements, scope, and resource availability.  - Utilize project management tools and software to develop and maintain schedules.  Resource Allocation:  - Work with project managers to identify and allocate resources required for each project phase.  - Ensure that resources are optimally utilized to meet project deadlines.  Progress Monitoring:  - Regularly monitor and update project schedules to reflect actual progress.  - Identify and analyse critical path activities and potential risks to the project timeline.  Risk Assessment:  - Conduct risk assessments related to project schedules and propose mitigation strategies.  - Collaborate with project teams to address and overcome potential scheduling challenges.  Communication:  - Communicate schedule updates, changes, and potential delays to project stakeholders.  - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant information for schedule updates.  Reporting:  - Prepare and distribute regular project status reports, highlighting key milestones, risks, and deviations from the schedule.  - Provide insights and recommendations to project managers and stakeholders.  Collaboration:  - Work closely with project managers, engineers, and other team members to understand project requirements and constraints.  - Facilitate communication and coordination among project teams.  Continuous Improvement:  - Identify opportunities for process improvement in project planning and scheduling.  - Stay updated on industry best practices and incorporate them into project planning processes.  Preferred candidate profile     - Bachelors degree in Mechanical engineering, project management, or a related field.  - Proven experience in project planning and scheduling, preferably in engineering or construction projects.  - Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel etc.)  - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.  Perks and benefits   PF

column2: Role & responsibilities   1. *Project Planning:* Developing detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation. And Reviewing the same in WRM,MRM and ensuring it's in line. 2. *Scheduling:* Creating and maintaining schedules to ensure timely completion of projects, and regular review of same and preparation of action needed for catch up schedule and bring notice to management in critical. 3. *Resource Management:* Coordinating with project managers to prepare for Resources chart required and ensure allocate resources efficiently, such as labor, materials, and equipment on daily basis to Management  4. *Risk Management:* Identifying potential risks to the project schedule and proposing mitigation strategies to minimize delays and highlight of criticality and ensure action implemented. 5. *Progress Monitoring:* Monitoring project progress against the planned schedule, identifying deviations, and recommending corrective actions on daily basis. 6. *Communication:* Facilitating communication between different project stakeholders to ensure everyone is informed about project schedules and progress. 7. *Documentation:* Maintaining accurate records of project plans, schedules, progress reports, and drawing record and PR and POs and any changes made during the construction process. 8. *Analysis and Reporting:* Analyzing project data to provide insights into performance trends and preparing regular reports for project stakeholders and management. Daily share of DLR and DPR to management. 9. *Continuous Improvement:* Identifying areas for improvement in the planning and scheduling processes and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.  Preparation of DLR and DPR on Daily Basis and Share to management with highlights where action required Preparation of agendas with respect to Milestone progress for the contractors, conducting weekly review meetings and creating MOM and maintaining a record Coordination and tracking of Drawing required and maintain the same in transmittal Maintain of Overall project Documentation in a file and share weekly once to management for review Coordination with all intra and inter department through in charge presence and maintenance of document in mail record and loop to management Preparation of materials requirements and PR raise and follow up WRT Milestone

with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure that project estimates align with budgetary and quality standards          Key Responsibilities:          Project Evaluation:Review project plans, specifications, and relevant documents to understand the scope and requirements of construction or engineering projects      Cost Analysis:Conduct detailed cost analysis for various project elements, including materials, labor, equipment, and subcontractor services      Collaborate with suppliers and subcontractors to obtain accurate pricing      Quantity Takeoff:Perform quantity takeoffs from project drawings and specifications to determine the quantity of materials needed for construction      Budget Preparation:Prepare comprehensive project cost estimates, considering all column2: Facilitates the timely planning of deliveries within a supply chain and optimize inventory planning to meet service, cost and timelines objectives.            Roles Responsibilities        Inventory control      Production plan completion with minimum delay      Maintain inventory at target levels      Maintain schedule stability      Identify and resolve problems relating to inventory      Schedule usage of production materials to ensure optimal production levels      Monitor material supply flow and identify any shortages or bottlenecks in usage      Demand forecasting: Estimating future demand for products or services based on historical data, market trends, and other relevant factors. Accurate demand forecasting helps in determining production levels and schedules.      Capacity planning: Assessing the production capacity of facilities, equipment, and labour to ensure that they align with the anticipated demand. It involves analysing current capacity, identifying bottlenecks, and making decisions regarding capacity expansion or contraction.      Production scheduling: Creating detailed plans and schedules for production activities, including the allocation of resources, and determining the sequence of operations. Scheduling considers factors such as product requirements, availability of resources, and delivery deadlines.      Material planning: Determining the quantity and timing of raw materials, components, and other inputs required for production. This involves maintaining an appropriate inventory level to avoid stockouts or excessive inventory holding costs.      Shop floor control: Monitoring and controlling production activities on the shop floor to ensure that they adhere to the planned schedules and quality standards. It involves tracking work progress, addressing deviations or delays, and resolving any issues that may arise during production.      Quality control: Implementing measures to maintain and improve product quality throughout the production process. This includes quality inspections, testing, and implementing corrective actidons to address any quality issues.      Performance measurement: Collecting and analyzing production data to evaluate the performance of the production system, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions for future planning.
column11: Supply chain, Product quality, Usage, Demand forecasting, Inventory control, Labour, Manager Quality Control, Shop floor control, Inventory, Capacity planning

column2: About the Job Skills Quantity Surveying Bill Of Quantities (BOQ) GFC Drawings AutoCAD Civil Engineering Rate Analysis industrial projects Candidate should have a minimum of 9-10 years of quantity surveying experience in civil contracting (Construction Company) or consultancy organizations. Should have a Diploma /B.E. /B. Tech Civil Engineering /Construction. Should have knowledge of preparing pre-estimates of the project. Candidate with industrial project experience will be preferable Should be a thorough theoretical and practical/field knowledge of civil construction activities like RCC work, road an, building work, structural steel work, architectural and finishing items, plumbing and sanitary items, aluminium section work, etc. Should be able to work with various design disciplines like structural engineers, architects, etc. and should be able to independently prepare an accurate quantity take-off (BOQ bill of quantities). Quantity take-off must be supported by measurement sheets and hand sketches. Should be proficient in spreadsheet / Microsoft excel functions. Should have a good proficiency in reviewing and taking measurements/dimensions from AutoCAD drawing files. Should be able to prepare rate analysis for civil construction items as per CPWD/DSR format. Should be experienced in preparing, checking and certifying civil construction running and final bills. Should be experienced with reconciliation of cement, steel and other free supply material. Should be able to take off accurate quantities from construction / GFC drawings. Should have strong knowledge of various thumb rules and ratios for civil construction items such as cement consumption, reinforcement consumption, etc. Having resourcefulness and contacts with suppliers, vendors and contractors of various civil construction trade items will be of an added advantage. Should be highly meticulous and thorough in his/her work. Candidates from Gujarat will be preferred.

column2: Complete Construction Project Planning Processes Most construction projects start with a civil project manager. These professionals review land surveys, assess project estimations and budgets, inspect existing structures, create design plans, and review potential safety issues. Oversee Construction Personnel Civil project managers often manage on-site construction crews. They are responsible for negotiating the contracts of subcontractors, communicating with inspectors and architects, meeting with construction managers, and coordinating the delivery of materials with vendors. Prepare Progress Reports and Attend Meetings It is typically up to civil project managers to generate reports focusing on project progress, job status, and costs. They usually attend weekly or biweekly meetings to present progress information to superiors.
column11: Project Management, Project Manager Civil, Construction Project Planning, construction, Project Planning

column2: Artech India is looking for Executive - Contract to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.      The Executive - Contract plays a crucial role in managing the contract lifecycle within an organization      They are responsible for drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts, ensuring compliance with legal standards and internal policies      This role involves collaboration with various departments to support the organization's contractual needs          Key Responsibilities:          Contract Drafting: Prepare, draft, and review contracts, agreements, and legal documents, ensuring accuracy, clarity, and adherence to legal requirements      Contract Negotiation: Collaborate with external parties, such as clients, vendors, and partners, to negotiate contract terms and conditions to achieve favorable outcomes for the organization      Legal Compliance: Ensure that contracts and agreements comply with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards      Contract Management: Oversee the complete contract lifecycle, from creation and negotiation to execution and archiving      Risk Assessment: Evaluate the potential risks and legal implications associated with contracts and provide recommendations to mitigate those risks      Document Tracking: Maintain a record of all contracts, track their status, and provide regular updates on contract obligations and deadlines      Contract Amendments: Assist in the preparation of contract amendments, extensions, and renewals      Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with various departments, including legal, procurement, sales, and finance, to address their specific contract needs      Vendor and Supplier Relationships: Manage relationships with vendors, suppliers, and other external partners through contract negotiations and compliance      Contract Reporting: Generate reports and summaries related to contract performance, obligations, and key terms

column2: Post-Contracts Management: ??Manage the post-contracts management process throughout the execution phase, ensuring compliance with  contractual obligations, specifications, and standards. ??Review and analyze contract documents, identifying key terms, conditions, and deliverables. ??Develop and maintain project-specific post-contracts management plans, outlining roles, responsibilities, and  timelines. ??Monitor project progress, milestones, and deliverables to ensure alignment with contractual requirements. ??Proactively identify and address potential risks, claims, and disputes, collaborating with internal and external  stakeholders to mitigate impacts. Quantity Surveying: ??Manage the quantity surveying activities, including measurement, valuation, and cost control, to accurately  assess the progress and value of work completed. ??Conduct detailed measurements and take-offs from project drawings, specifications, and site inspections. ??Prepare and review cost estimates, bills of quantities (BOQs), and tender documents for accuracy and  completeness. ??Evaluate variations and change orders, assessing their impact on project costs, schedules, and resources. ??Implement robust cost tracking and reporting mechanisms to monitor project expenditures, forecast costs, and  identify deviations from budgets. Cost Control: ??Manage costs throughout the post-contract phase to ensure adherence to the project budget and cost plan. ??Manage actual costs against budget allocations, identifying any discrepancies or cost overruns. ??Take proactive measures to mitigate cost overruns, including implementing cost-saving initiatives and value  engineering solutions. ??Work closely with project teams to forecast future costs, assess financial risks, and develop strategies to keep  costs under control. Variations Management: ??Manage variations to the scope of variations, assessing their impact on project costs, schedules, and resources. ??Evaluate the cost and time implications of variations, ensuring that they are properly documented and  authorized. ??Negotiate with the contractor to reach agreement on the cost and scope of variations, minimizing any adverse  impact on project budgets and timelines. ??Maintain accurate records of all variations and associated costs for reporting and auditing purposes. Payment Certificates: ??Manage and issue payment certificates for the contractor in accordance with the terms of the contract. ??Verify the work completed by the contractor and calculate the amount payable based on the agreed rates and  quantities. ??Ensure that payment certificates accurately reflect the progress of work and comply with contractual  requirements.   ??Manage the project stakeholders to expedite the certification and processing of payments, minimizing delays  and disputes. Final Account: ??Manage the preparation of the final account at the conclusion of the project, ensuring that all costs, variations,  and adjustments are accurately accounted for. ??Verify the completeness and accuracy of all financial documentation, including invoices, payment certificates,  and change orders. ??Collaborate with project teams and external stakeholders to resolve any outstanding issues or discrepancies  related to the final account. ??Manage the timely settlement of the final account, ensuring that all parties are in agreement and that any  outstanding payments are processed promptly. Dispute Resolution: ??Provide expert advice and assistance in the resolution of disputes between the contractor and the client,  particularly those related to cost and contract variations. ??Manage post contractual documents, project records, and relevant legislation to assess the merits of each  party's position. ??Manage the mediation, arbitration, or other dispute resolution processes as required, representing the interests  of the organization and advocating for fair and equitable outcomes. ??Collaborate with legal counsel and other stakeholders to develop negotiation strategies and reach mutually  acceptable resolutions to disputes.

column2: Job   Description Planning   Executive   -   Irrigation   Project Profile Summary : A Planning Executive in a construction company holds a critical position responsible for orchestrating various aspects of project planning, coordination, and execution. Their key responsibilities include developing comprehensive project plans, efficiently allocating resources, managing project schedules, mitigating risks, controlling budgets, ensuring quality standards, maintaining regulatory compliance, facilitating communication among stakeholders, generating progress reports, and driving continuous improvement initiatives. By effectively fulfilling these duties, Planning Executives play a crucial role in ensuring that construction projects are completed successfully, on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of clients and stakeholders. Responsibilities: 1. Assist in developing and maintaining project plans and schedules for the irrigation project,  including activity sequencing, resource allocation, and critical path analysis, utilizing project  management software and tools. 2. Support the Planning Manager and Planning Officers in gathering input from project teams,  subcontractors, and suppliers to ensure accurate and realistic project schedules that align with  project objectives and constraints. 3. Monitor project progress against established schedules, track key milestones, and report  deviations or delays to the Planning Manager for timely intervention and corrective action. 4. Participate in progress meetings with project teams to review schedule performance, identify  potential issues or risks, and contribute ideas for problem-solving and optimization. 5. Collaborate with procurement and logistics teams to facilitate the timely procurement and  delivery of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities, ensuring  alignment with project schedules. 6. Assist in analyzing project data and performance metrics to identify trends, areas for  improvement, and opportunities to optimize resource utilization and project efficiency. 7. Support the identification, assessment, and mitigation of potential risks and uncertainties that  may impact project schedule or budget, under the guidance of the Planning Manager. 8. Provide regular reports and updates on project schedule performance, including progress  against milestones, critical path analysis, and forecasted completion dates, to project  stakeholders and management. 9. Assist project managers in resolving scheduling conflicts, resource constraints, and other issues  that may arise during project execution, demonstrating effective communication and problem-  solving skills. 10. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and quality standards throughout the  project planning and execution phases, with a focus on safety, quality, and environmental  sustainability.   Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in BE in civil engineering. 2. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. 3. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. 5. Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. 6. Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. 7. Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget. Project   details: 1. Company Headquarter: Nagpur 2. Company: Infratech Construction Company 3. Project Name: Jigaon Project 4. Site location: Tal. Nandura, Dist.Buldana. Construction of Earthen Dam including spillway stilling basin, divide wall approach road, tail channel of Jigaon Project.

column2: As the Planning Co-ordinator in the Central Planning Team, you will play a key role in the operation of DAZN s global live and non-live event planning.      We are looking for a talented, diligent candidate with a strong attention to detail and organisational skills.      You will help to manage the events we schedule onto our platform, working with regional editorial, production and operational teams to ensure that all factors relating to our broadcast output are considered.      You will play a pivotal role in determining what content is played out to our subscriber base. Attend weekly and monthly planning meetings with local and central teams.      Assist in ad hoc project work with the Central team      Learn and maintain a strong understanding of DAZN KPIs. column2: This is the perfect place to work if you are passionate about technology and want an opportunity to use your creativity to help grow and scale a global range of IT systems, Infrastructure and IT Services. Our cutting-edge technology allows us to stream sports content to millions of concurrent viewers globally across multiple platforms and devices. DAZN?? Cloud based architecture unifies a range of technologies in order to deliver a seamless user experience and support a global user base and company infrastructure.    This role will be based in our brand-new Hyderabad office. Join us in India?? beautiful ??ity of Pearls??and bring your ambition to life.     How do you fancy being able to influence a product that is used by millions of users globally across multiple devices daily??DAZN is a rapidly scaling media streaming global platform, offering the most comprehensive selection of live and on-demand sports content and original programming available anywhere in the world.   Role Overview   As the Planning Co-ordinator in the Central Planning Team, you will play a key role in the operation of DAZN?? global live and non-live event planning. We are looking for a talented, diligent candidate with a strong attention to detail and organisational skills. You will help to manage the events we schedule onto our platform, working with regional editorial, production and operational teams to ensure that all factors relating to our broadcast output are considered. You will play a pivotal role in determining what content is played out to our subscriber base.?   Responsibilities & Requirements   Working on a 24/7 shift rota basis, manage the planning of all live and non-live content that appears on the platform from multiple broadcast partners. Ensure that accurate event information is entered into the MediaGenix WhatsON broadcast management system. Proactively manage schedule changes. Act as key operational liaison between Central Planning, Production and Broadcast Operations teams to help implement content strategy Act as key point of contact communicating DAZN schedule information to wider business units and external partners. Attend weekly and monthly planning meetings with local and central teams. Assist in ad hoc project work with the Central team Learn and maintain a strong understanding of DAZN KPIs.   Essential Skills & Experience   Exceptional organisational and time management skills. Strong attention to detail. Ability to work both as part of a team and individually. Ability to adapt to changing business needs, cultures, conditions and work responsibilities Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines. Flexibility, proactivity, and resilience         Even Better to have   ? Knowledge of, or strong interest in, broadcast workflows, formats and operating systems. Excellent knowledge of, or willingness to research and learn, sport competition formats Strong Microsoft Office product skills, notably Microsoft Excel  At DAZN, we bring ambition to life. We are innovators, game-changers and pioneers. So, if you want to push boundaries and make an impact, DAZN is the place to be.?    As part of our team,you'll have the opportunity to make your mark and the power to make change happen. We're doing things no-one has done before, giving fans and customers access to sport anytime, anywhere. We're using world-class technology to transform sports and revolutionise the industry and we're not going to stop.?  ?   DAZN VALUES ??THE ??OW??IN WHAT WE DO:? ?  ?   AMBITIOUS ??people who want to make a big impact and drive DAZN forward.?   ?   INVENTIVE ??people with bright ideas who deliver great new experiences for our customers ??and improvements for our business.? People who come up with better, simpler ways of doing things. ?  ?   PASSIONATE ??people who are proud of our product, our content and our business ??and love to shout about it.? People who love what they do and show commitment every day. ?  ?   BRAVE ??people who take difficult decisions to help us focus on improving DAZN, our performance and our results.?   ?   SUPPORTIVE ??people who know that we achieve more as a team than as individuals.? People value inclusion and look out for each other, helping their colleagues enjoy their work and develop their careers.? People who consider others before making decisions. ?    At DAZN, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment that values equality and diversity, where everyone can contribute and have their voices heard. This means hiring and developing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, age groups, sexual orientations, gender identities and abilities.?    Everyone has the opportunity to make change and impact our DEI journey by joining our ERGs: Proud@DAZN, Women@DAZN, Disability@DAZN and ParentZone.  ?  If you?? like to include a cover letter with your application, please feel free to. Please do not feel you need to apply with a photo or disclose any other information that is not related to your professional experience.  ?  Our aim is to make our hiring processes as accessible for everyone as possible, including providing adjustments for interviews where we can.  ?  We look forward to hearing from you.

column2: Job   Description: Planning   Manager   -   Irrigation   Project Profile   Summary:  As a Planning Manager for Irrigation Projects, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the effective planning, coordination, and execution of irrigation construction projects. Your primary responsibility will be to develop comprehensive project plans, schedules, and strategies to optimize resource utilization and ensure timely completion of projects. You will work closely with project teams, stakeholders, and subcontractors to oversee all aspects of project planning and ensure alignment with client requirements and industry standards. Responsibilities: 1. Strategic Planning: ??Develop detailed project plans and schedules for irrigation construction projects, considering project scope, timelines, resource requirements, and budget constraints. ??Conduct feasibility studies, risk assessments, and site evaluations to identify potential challenges and develop mitigation strategies. 2. Resource Allocation: ??Coordinate with project managers, engineers, and procurement teams to allocate  resources (including manpower, equipment, and materials) effectively across irrigation  projects. ??Monitor resource utilization and adjust plans as needed to optimize productivity and minimize costs. 3. Schedule Management: ??Create and maintain project schedules, outlining key milestones, tasks, and dependencies for irrigation construction activities. ??Monitor project progress against schedules, identify delays or deviations, and implement corrective actions to ensure adherence to timelines. 4. Stakeholder Communication: ??Serve as the primary point of contact for project planning-related inquiries from internal teams, clients, regulatory authorities, and community stakeholders. ??Facilitate regular meetings and progress updates to communicate project status, address concerns, and solicit feedback. 5. Performance Analysis: ??Implement performance measurement systems to track project progress, analyze data, and generate reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) for irrigation projects. ??Identify trends, areas for improvement, and lessons learned to inform future planning activities and enhance project efficiency. 6. Compliance and Quality Assurance: ??Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, codes, and standards governing irrigation construction projects. ??Implement quality assurance processes to maintain high standards of workmanship and deliverables. 7. Continuous Improvement: ??Lead initiatives to streamline planning processes, enhance efficiency, and incorporate best practices into irrigation project planning and execution. ??Stay updated on industry trends, technological advancements, and emerging practices related to irrigation construction. 8. Team Leadership: ??Provide leadership and guidance to planning engineers, coordinators, and project teams, fostering a collaborative and supportive work environment. ??Mentor team members, conduct performance evaluations, and identify opportunities for professional development. Requirements: ??Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering. ??Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. ??Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. ??Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. ??Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. ??Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. ??Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget.   Project   details: ??Company Headquarter:  Nagpur ??Company:  Infratech   Construction   Company ??Project Name:  Jigaon   Project ??Site location:  Tal.   Nandura,   Dist.Buldana. Construction   of   Earthen   Dam   including   spillway   stilling   basin,   divide   wall   approach   road,   tail channel   of   Jigaon   Project.

column2: *    Project Planning: Develop comprehensive project plans, including schedules, timelines, and resource allocation. Coordinate with various teams to gather project requirements and ensure alignment with project goals. Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. Monitor project progress and adjust plans as necessary to meet changing requirements. Quantity Surveying: Prepare accurate quantity take-offs and cost estimates for materials, labor, and equipment. Evaluate subcontractor and vendor bids to ensure competitiveness and compliance with project requirements. Monitor project costs and expenditures to ensure adherence to budgetary constraints. Strong knowledge of project management methodologies, cost control techniques, and contract administration. Proficiency in project management software and tools, such as Primavera P6, MS Project, and Excel. Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail. Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders at all levels. Professional certifications such as MRICS, PMP, or similar are desirable. Note: Mandatory experience of 10-13 years in Roads Project.

column2: Key Responsibilities Employees may specialize in planning activities involving production control, inventory control, process control, or shop floor control / Material Resources Planning (MRP) integrity Maintains Oracle work order release schedule that provides material on-time to manufacturing and engineering. Reschedules and/or completes no-charge, all discrete jobs as required. Increases component availability at time of release by performing pre-shortage analysis. Performs work order variance analysis. Reviews MRP execution and ensures accuracy of information; reconciles supply and demand; validates master scheduling and/or PDS requirements. Reviews and ensures proper disposition of Engineering Change Orders (ECO's). Performs regular system maintenance and audits to ensure system accuracy. Prepares status reports of all ECOs and ECRs in process Participates in floor audits with Finance and resolves WIP issues. Attends production meetings and provides status on material shortage commit dates. Changes "make" level lead times in accordance with reality on the manufacturing floor. Works with engineers to manage materials for special engineering projects. May work with work centers on shop floor control activities. Inventory Control Analyzes usage data and stock levels to order parts to satisfy service levels; maintains inventory levels per plan and expedites shortages; may forecast spare parts needs. Examines material variances, resolves problems where possible, and/or communicates more difficult problems to management. Assists in setting up new inventory systems or modifying existing systems, when necessary; assigns appropriate expediting duties to expediters. May manage obsolete inventories. Process Control Participates in identifying root cause and corrective action from PCI reporting and metrics, drives cycle counting. Other Requirements:  This position may require standing for extended periods of time, walking, working in tight spaces, bending, squatting, twisting, kneeling, reaching, lifting, the ability to distinguish between colors, the ability to work in an environment with noise that may be difficult for some individuals with sensitivity to noise, and the use of hand and power tools. Additionally, because this position also may involve working in a clean room, the use of appropriate Personal Protective Equipment such as coveralls, hoods, booties, safety glasses, gloves, respirators, chemical aprons, and face shields may be required. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates expanded conceptual knowledge in own discipline and broadens capabilities Business Expertise Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work Leadership No supervisory responsibilities but provides informal guidance to new team members Problem Solving Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents  Impact Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team; works within guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations

column2: The Project Field Coordinator(s) will work closely with the Sr      Program Associate in engaging with the respective schools in their block(s) in Jodhpur, Rajasthan as part of the Foundational Literacy initiative in Rajasthan      S/he will support the Sr Program Associate in the execution of the Foundational literacy program at block level and coordination with various stakeholders (government and non-profit partner) to sustain the impact and interventions from the program      The position will report to the Program Associate/Sr Program Associate            Duties & Responsibilities:                      ?       The Project Field Coordinator(s) will serve as a technical resource for literacy program at the block level and support block level functionaries and PEEOs in delivering the various program activities, innovations and will have the following specific key roles and responsibilities:                        ?       On-ground implementation:            Develop a thorough understanding of Room to Read s Literacy program design.          Interact with key stakeholders (government departments and officials such as PEEOs, CBEO etc.) on a day-to-day basis to ensure delivery on program objectives.          Work closely with teachers, PEEOs and CBEO to implement literacy program and innovations as part of Project.          Identify operational bottlenecks and weaknesses, wherever applicable and suggest solutions to District Lead/Sr Program Associate.          Organize and lead monthly review meetings of the PEEOs.          Ensure proper implementation of community engagement plans.          Participate actively in events, campaigns, meetings, and trainings through the virtual and offline mode.                Technical Support/Monitoring and Data Collection:            Assist SPA/PA in planning and delivery of monthly review meetings, including documentation and data provision for the same.          Act as a resource person with respect to PEEO & Teacher training.          Regular school visits (stand-alone and jointly with PEEOs/Block officials) for technical support to teachers /PEEOs, data collection.          Track and report performance on key indicators on a timely basis as per the RM&E framework.                Communication & Documentation:            Documentation and communication of program achievements/outcomes through reports and notes.          Preparing and managing documentation related to program implementation e.g. approvals, letters, etc.          Documentation of on-ground learnings and knowledge received from the ground to support coalition partners internal capacity / knowledge building.                Qualifications:            Bachelor s degree in education or equivalent is required.          Work experience of minimum 3-5 years in development sector          Experience with on-ground program implementation mandatory.          Knowledge of Foundational Literacy concepts.          Experiences working with government in education sector and teachers training is required.          Fluency in Hindi (spoken, written, and reading) is required and basic communication in English is preferred.          Desired skills include written and oral communication skills, ability to adapt to emerging situations, interpersonal skills and networking skills, ability to work on tight deadlines.          Room to Read offers a competitive salary with excellent benefits.          The non-monetary compensation includes a unique opportunity to be part of an innovative, meaningful, and rapidly growing organization that is changing transforming the lives of millions of children in developing countries on literacy and gender equality in education.                To be successful at Room to Read, you will also:          Have passion for our mission and a strong desire to impact a dynamic nonprofit organization      Be a proactive and innovative thinker who achieves results and creates positive change      Have a very high level of personal and professional integrity and trustworthiness      Embrace diversity and a commitment to collaboration      Thrive in a fast-paced and fun environment

column2: Greetings from Godrej Properties Limited Job Title Manger Project Planning Location:  Worli and Kandivali JOB DESCRIPTION: The role involves assisting the project team in construction planning from project inception stage to hand over.  Co-ordination with all departments at Regional Office/ Site office to avoid project delays and suggest corrective measures. Responsibility Area Project Planning Understand the scope of the project  Construct a network of work appropriate for the specific project  Create a logical sequence out of WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) Establish the critical path for the project Create a Master Project schedule. Identify the best series of events in the correct order for the project to finish on time and on budget Prepare the construction schedule & highlight anticipated delays/deviancies in advance Analyze the gaps between the planned V/s actual and highlight the areas needing attention for action of the project team Prepare method statement & submits to clients/consultants for approval Assist in laying down methodology for project execution and incorporate client initiated changes Coordinating with Contractors , Consultants and PMC to get the work done at site   Project Schedule and Monitoring Monitor the progress of the project at different stages of its development  Make sure the achieved progress on the project fits the progress anticipated in the schedule  Provide advice to concerned parties involved in the project on delays/ deviations observed Ensure that all the separate elements of the project fit together and are working towards a common aim Review effectiveness Timely resolution of issues   POSITION SPECIFICATIONS:   Threshold Education Qualification & Experience B.E/ B. Tech or Diploma in Civil Engineering. Should possess 10-15 years of planning experience in large construction projects (preferably residential multistoried apartment complex / townships). Should have hands on experience in modern construction technologies, planning various activities of the projects coordinating with all departments including micro planning and budgeting. Working knowledge in MS Projects and or Primavera essential

column2: Perform routine aspects of Planning, Scheduling and progress measurement independently applying procedures, best practices and analysis to any size and type of project. Applies a sound knowledge of Project Controls principles in general. Can handle Planning & Scheduling aspects of FEED projects and large EPC projects independently. Leads, guides and coaches less experienced Planning & Scheduling personnel. Can function as Project Controls Manager on small to medium projects. Actively participates in maintenance and development of Planning & Scheduling procedures and tools. Manages his team to contribute to a safe working environment.       Essential Qualifications and Education:          Advanced Technical Education (B.Sc./M.Sc. or equivalent)      10-15 Years experience in a planning & Scheduling role in Oil & Gas or in related / comparable industries      Good Communication skills, team player     Proficient in Primavera P6     Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint & workable to deal with resistance, Meet deadlines and is able to handle changing needs and requirements.     Demonstrate an understanding of cost controls procedures and best practices. Actively develop more FEED and EPC knowledge.          Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Prepare and co-ordinate multi-discipline summary level schedules. To provide guidance to junior planning staff in preparation of detailed schedules.     Attend regular progress meetings with project Management, Engineering, Procurement and Construction as appropriate to ensure the work is being carried out in line with the agreed schedules.     Ensure the proper interfacing of schedules between Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, Installation, and Commissioning as appropriate.     Establish planning IT requirements and direct their implementation.     Ensure the timely collection of accurate updated information is incorporated into the schedules, analyze the effects of the updated information and highlight any adverse situations to the Project Manager or relevant functional Manager.     Evolve and propose possible solutions to programming problems.     Ensure the timely preparation of charts and diagrams as required for reports, indicating planned, actual and forecast.     Prepare narratives for reports, analyze achievements and their likely effects on remaining scope of work.     Incorporate changes to the scope of work into schedules, histograms and progress curves and analyze their effects.     Establish effective working relationships with appropriate project staff to assist in the provision of timely and accurate update information.      Be able to represent Project Management in client discussions with respect to all aspects of planning & scheduling, manpower forecasting, progress measurement and resource control     Be able to establish a planning, progress and performance system on any type of project (BE, E, P, EP, EPC, EPFC, PMC, Multi-office).     Be able to setup and/or direct the setup of effective physical progress measurement based on earned value principles.      Be able to supervise and or work on multiple projects if required.     Be able and prepared to act as Project Controls manager on a small project.     Be able to perform a Monte Carlo / Schedule Risk analysis.

Project Schedule and Monitoring         Monitor the progress of the project at different stages of its development.      Make sure the achieved progress on the project fits the progress anticipated in the schedule      Provide advice to concerned parties involved in the project on delays/ deviations observed     Ensure that all the separate elements of the project fit together and are working towards a common aim         Process Adherence:         Comply with company defined guidelines and processes.     Adhere to project timelines     Follow required safety parameters     Monitor adherence to process done by team across board.         Process Improvement         Identify processes/procedures that need improvement or new     Recommend the process improvement ideas to streamline efficiency/costs/productivity      Undertake the process improvement activities in own work area         Automation of data         Maintaining and ensuring data on company defined software      Maintaining repository of past data for project performances      Maintaining accuracy of data in Power BI, ASTA, any other portal      Driving site and zonal teams to ensure accurate and timely data flow     Ensuring elimination of manual data and movement to system based data         Project Planning         Understand the scope of the project      Construct a network of work appropriate for the specific project      Create a logical sequence out of WBS (Work Breakdown Structure)     Establish the critical path for the project     Create a Master Project schedule. Identify the best series of events in the correct order for the project to finish on time and on budget     Prepare the construction schedule highlight anticipated delays/deviancies in advance     Analyze the gaps between the planned V/s actual and highlight the areas needing attention for action of the project team     Prepare method statement submits to clients/consultants for approval     Assist in laying down methodology for project execution and incorporate client initiated changes     Coordinating with Contractors , Consultants and PMC to get the work done at site           Who are we looking for       Education     :         B.E/ B.Tech in Civil Engineering          Experience:         Should possess 8-14 years of planning experience in large construction projects (preferably residential multistore apartment complex / townships). Should have hands on experience in modern construction technologies, planning various activities of the projects coordinating with all departments including micro planning and budgeting.         Skills:         Working knowledge in MS Projects and or Primavera essential

column2: Key Accountabilities   Pre-Construction Planning Integrated micro level planning & scheduling of multi discipline activities viz. - Liaison, Design, Pre-Construction activities, Marketing & Sales etc. Creating multiphase plans for the projects. Reviewing & tracking the approved schedule until project launch & start of construction activities. Reviewing weekly & monthly progress MIS reports for review. Identifying Pre-Construction project risk, creating mitigation plans, risk triggers & monitoring the same. Raising flag on regular basis to enable informed decision making for management on all delays. Proficiency in creating plans in the latest ERP software viz. ASTA, MSP etc. to integrate with ERP Project Management module. Construction Planning Creating & integrating construction plan for execution, incorporating multi decision activities. Work Break Down structure and activity level planning with integrated labor and cash flow planning. Generating work progress Curve, Cash Flow Curve and reviewing qualitative comparative analysis for review. Generating various progress & analytical reports enabling brisk decision making for on- course corrective measures. Performing weekly review and communicating critical actions to the Projects Execution team. Coordinate with the on-site Project team for conducting review meetings involving contractors, consultants, etc. Coordinate with Liaison Team to ensure uninterrupted Construction at site by obtaining all necessary statutory stage wise approvals including the Occupation/Completion Certificates Delay analysis and incorporating learning in the future progress. Creating Recovery plan by crashing activities & planning for resource optimization. Providing inputs to the Execution, Procurement and Finance/Accounts team for the respective function. Costing and Budgeting Ensure accurate estimation & costing of present and future projects. Prepare cost-review statements of various projects. Analyze project requirements, project feasibility data, contingencies etc. Prepare consolidated budget for the project and obtain the approval of top management  Cost Planning - Reviewing preliminary budget estimate based on the Concept / schematic drawings / Views etc. Coordinate with Procurement/ Contracts, Design, and on-site Teams for drawings, details of contract awarded and rates of various line items. Monitor detailed cost estimates of the project & review periodically. Make comparative cost statements for projects. Prepare cost review statements, reconciliation & cash flow statements. Suggest various cost-saving measures with respect to design, material or services. Monitor all material consumption and contracts in ERP. Monitor costs & progress through regular site visits and co-ordination with Contracts Team. Ensure rates in the WO & PO are within budget/estimate. Monitor timely generation of budget vs actuals reports on a monthly basis. Verify total project expenditure report at the end of the project to determine total project cost. Guide team members in costing & budgeting to ensure cost incurred until date and cost to complete statements generated as and when required. Institute a standard operating process. Identify processes/procedures in own work area that need improvement. Recommend process improvement ideas to streamline efficiency/costs/productivity  Undertake process improvement activities in own work area. Value Engineering Conduct Technical Due Diligence for the project during its design evolution phase. Ensuring that the Value of the product is either enhanced or maintained at reduced cost by conducting a structured Value Engineering exercise. Coordinate with Design team & all respective consultants to ensure that the product is designed for optimization. Capture the learning from Value Engineering (VE) exercise and implement in the upcoming projects. Use VE principles in Structural engineering, MEP, Infrastructure works & Architectural specifications. Project Management Evaluate various construction methodologies, technology and adopt, implement the most appropriate solution for the project in coordination with the Project Team. Conduct appropriate Buildability studies to ensure smooth and efficient construction. Prepare Risk register and maintain it to address project level risk. Evaluate the right execution strategy for phase wise development integrating the stages of statutory approvals, launch plan, cash flow requirement and business needs. Gather relevant data required for planning from Project In-charge. Provide accurate data to prepare BMCP (Baseline Master Construction Planning. Monitoring project progress each activity in line with BMCP/PMP. Assist in detailing WBS (Work Breakdown Schedule). Update BMCP in ERP and track progress of the project on real time basis. Update any changes in BMCP immediately in BMCP. Report any deviation from BMCP to Director Projects. Update and feed approved plan schedule and budget in ERP (WBS Provide relevant and accurate data for MIS reports/meetings  Desired Candidate Profile    BE(Civil) /NICMAR(PGPMP) would be an added advantage   Experience in Real Estate (Residential & Commercial) preferred  5-12 years' relevant experience of related work in planning and scheduling both engineering and construction activities is required.  Candidate should have Residential & Commercial work experience. Local candidates with Gujarati Speaking will be given preference.  Perks and Benefits     Salary and Benefits will be commensurate with qualifications & experience and will not be a limiting factor for deserving candidates.

column1: QS & Estimation (Interior & MEP) - Assistant Manager || Ahmedabad
column2: Role & responsibilities Responsible for managing quantity surveying and billing activities for interior design projects, ensuring accurate cost estimation, billing, and financial tracking throughout the project lifecycle. Quantity Surveying: Conduct quantity take-offs, prepare BOQs (Bills of Quantities), and analyze construction drawings to estimate material, labor, and equipment costs for interior projects. Cost Estimation: Utilize industry-standard methods and software to calculate project costs, including materials, labor, and overheads, ensuring accuracy and adherence to budgetary constraints. Billing: Generate and review invoices, track project expenses, and reconcile billing discrepancies to ensure timely and accurate invoicing and payments. Contract Management: Assist in contract administration, including reviewing contracts, preparing change orders, and evaluating variations to ensure compliance with contractual agreements. Cost Control: Monitor project expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and implement measures to control costs and maximize profitability. Coordination: Collaborate with project managers, architects, contractors, and suppliers to obtain necessary information, resolve billing issues, and ensure project milestones are met on time and within budget. Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including cost reports, payment records, and change orders, to provide accurate financial reporting and support audit processes. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all quantity surveying and billing activities comply with industry standards, regulations, and company policies while striving for continuous improvement in processes and procedures.

column2: Successful Estimator display strong Estimation, analytical, problem-solving, organizational, and written/oral communication skills. They should be detail-oriented team members who can consistently meet deadlines and possess the ability to work independently as needed. Computer, interpersonal and customer service skills are necessary.       Responsibilities and Duties         Work independently or with our Lead Estimator of Burns & McDonnell US office.         Estimate:    Develop accurate cost estimates for Transmission, Distribution, and Substation projects, considering materials, labor, equipment, and other relevant factors especially for the US EPC projects that includes all disciplines. Estimate $ cost for Transmission Line, Substation & Distribution for Engineering, Land Acquisition, right of way, Material & Construction) Class 5, Class4, Class 3, & Class 2 Estimates.       Material Takeoffs:    Conduct meticulous manual and digital material takeoffs from engineered plans and sections, ensuring precision in quantifying required materials and components for project execution with minimum data as per AACEi standard. Estimate quantity for High Voltage Transmission Line, Substation & Distribution of Electric Utility (Material Take off from Drawings/Maps) or by thumb rule.       Project Evaluation:    Analyze project specifications, blueprints, and other documentation to assess project scope and determine resource requirements.       Collaborative Approach:    Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineers, project managers, subcontractors, and suppliers to gather essential information and ensure comprehensive estimations.       Cost Analysis and Optimization:    Conduct thorough cost analysis, identifying areas for cost savings, value engineering, and alternate solutions without compromising quality.       Bid Preparation:    Prepare comprehensive bid proposals, ensuring accuracy, competitiveness, and compliance with project requirements and industry standards.       Risk Assessment:    Evaluate potential risks associated with projects and provide mitigation strategies to minimize financial exposure.       Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with industry trends, market conditions, and technological advancements to improve estimating techniques and processes, including enhancing proficiency in digital tools for material takeoffs         Software s:    Work on Software like HCSS, SageEOS, CostOS, Heavybid, Bluebeam, or such software or even excel templates already developed for Estimation.         He/she will be doing Estimation of various type of projects but mainly Electrical & Gas Transmission & Distribution Projects, Substation Projects etc.         He/she will do regular team s meetings with BMcD US office to understand the work, executing the Estimation work and keep them posted about the status or any such meetings.           Qualifications           Minimum Diploma or BE/BTech Full time (Any Engineering Stream, preferably Electrical or Civil)         Relevant Experience: 5-15 yrs.         Should have strong capabilities in Estimation of High Voltage Transmission and Substation projects         Strong understanding of electrical construction practices, codes, and regulations related to Transmission, Distribution, and Substation projects         Understanding of Engineering, Material, Equipment, Labor, Permits & Construction terminologies.         Intermediate level knowledge of engineering, procurement, contracts, construction, and startup

column2: Project Assessment: Evaluate potential real estate development opportunities, conducting feasibility studies and site assessments to determine project viability and constraints. Planning and Design:  Develop site plans and infrastructure designs for real estate projects, considering factors such as site layout, grading, drainage, utilities, and environmental impact. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure compliance with zoning ordinances, land use regulations, environmental regulations, and other applicable laws and standards throughout the planning and design process. Permitting and Approvals:  Prepare permit applications and coordinate with regulatory agencies to obtain necessary approvals for real estate development projects, including land development permits, environmental permits, and building permits. Budgeting and Cost Estimation:  Develop project budgets and cost estimates for civil engineering components of real estate projects, monitoring expenses and managing costs throughout the project lifecycle. Contractor Management:  Choose and manage contractors, consultants, and vendors involved in civil engineering aspects of real estate development projects, ensuring quality, timeliness, and cost-effectiveness. Construction Oversight:  Supervise construction activities, including site preparation, earthwork, utility installation, and road construction, to ensure compliance with design specifications, safety standards, and project schedules. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and issues related to civil engineering aspects of real estate projects and develop strategies to mitigate risks and minimize project delays. Stakeholder Communication:  Communicate project status, progress, and challenges to internal stakeholders, including senior management, real estate development teams, and other departments. Sustainability Integration:  Incorporate sustainable design principles and practices into real estate development projects, promoting environmental stewardship and resource efficiency.  Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile    Bachelor's or Masters degree in Civil Engineering + NICMAR 5 to 10 experience in civil engineering, site development, or real estate development Proficiency in AutoCAD, MS Projects and other relevant engineering software. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of zoning regulations, land development processes, and environmental regulations. Familiarity with sustainable design principles and green building practices. Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.

column2: About the Project: AMRUT 2.0 is a step towards Aatma Nirbhar Bharat with aim of making the cities 'water secure' and providing functional water tap connections to all households. This will be achieved through circular economy of water by effecting water source conservation, rejuvenation of water bodies and wells, recycle/ reuse of treated used water, and rainwater harvesting by involving community at large. Karnataka Urban Water Supply & Drainage Board (KUWS&DB) is the implementing agency for AMRUT 2.0 project works in Karnataka. KUWS&DB has appointed IPE Global Limited as the Project Development and Management Consultant (PDMC) for AMRUT 2.0 mission. Scope of services of the PDMC broadly covers planning, design, supervision and management of projects. PDMC is assisting in preparation of various plans and carrying out investigations, engineering designs, DPRs, procurement, and project implementation using latest IT tools and techniques. PDMC is helping in monitoring physical & financial progress of projects. Job Description:  Track project and project implementation activities, target dates, outcomes and outputs against each indicator to monitor and evaluate the performance of the project and the subprojects under each tranche.  To support/overview system improvements in PMU/ULB for real-time monitoring.  To update and maintain central database for physical and financial progress of work.  Develop MIS Process improvement for increase efficiency  Assist in preparation of QPR, annual reports and other mandatory deliverables.  Coordinate between PMU, PIU and consultant team  Coordination within field and office activities  Prepare and submit monthly staff and work schedule to PMU and respective PIUs and ensure implementation.  Work assigned by the competent Authority   Qualification Required:  Graduate in Civil Engineering / IT / Computer Science / MCA or equivalent  Minimum of 5 years work experience on similar infrastructure projects in India (water, wastewater, drainage, urban infrastructure, rural/other infrastructure, etc.)  Experience in database and document management, preparation of progress reports, project monitoring, analysis, project coordination is required.  Proficiency in using MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook is required.  Proficiency in using MS Project shall be an advantage.  Experience of working on urban water supply or wastewater projects during any of the following stages (planning, design, tendering, construction supervision) will be an advantage. Job Locations: Mysuru Kalaburagi About the Company: IPE Global Limited  is an international development consulting group providing expert technical assistance and solutions for equitable development and sustainable growth in developing countries. The groups areas of expertise include Health, Nutrition and WASH, Urban and Infrastructure Development, Education and Skills Development, Private Sector Development, Environment and Climate Change, Social and Economic Empowerment, Governance, Grant and Fund Management, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning, and Information Technology & e-Governance. We are ISO 9001:2015 certified, CMMI Level 3, ISO 27001:2013 and ISO 14001:2015 certified company. Over last 25 years, we have successfully implemented over 700 projects in over 100 countries. We have over 800 full time professional staff and over 1000 empanelled consultants working on various projects across the globe. We partner with multilateral & bilateral agencies including DFID, USAID, World Bank, DANIDA, KfW, EU, ADB, etc.; governments; private sector; and philanthropic organisation like BMGF, MasterCard Foundation, etc. We have subsidiaries and offices in UK (IPE Triple Line), Kenya, Ethiopia, India, Bangladesh, and Philippines. column2: Role & responsibilities   Prepare detailed maintenance schedules in Primavera P6 and MS Projects. Develop and maintain other planning documents such as Progress S Curve, Earned Value Curve, and Manpower Histogram. Generate daily, weekly, and monthly progress reports. Create look-ahead plans, micro-level schedules, progressive invoices, and cash flow reports. Critical Path Monitoring: Regularly monitor critical paths and prepare schedule impact reports for project management. Assess progress and completion forecasts. Provide solutions to mitigate schedule delays or optimize project completion timelines. Evaluate project progress against historical indicators on a weekly basis. Provide management with comparative analysis and interact with clients, consultants, and subcontractors regarding work progress. Prepare detailed schedules based on specifications, drawings, and bill of quantities. Coordinate maintenance schedules with equipment suppliers, erection teams, and testing and commissioning teams to align with the project completion plan. Collaborate with the engineering and procurement departments to ensure seamless integration of maintenance activities with material and equipment availability. Implement cost-efficient maintenance methods. Track design approvals, maintenance drawings, material approvals, site inspections, and bill of quantities variations to apply for extensions of time when necessary. Monitor various project activities (e.g., material delivery, site clearance, activity duration, and potential holds). Update the Project Manager on any risks foreseen for project completion and provide actionable suggestions. Preferred candidate profile   Graduate in Mechanical or Electrical Engineer with 8+ years of experience in planning and monitoring MEP facility maintenance works. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in managing plumbing, air conditioning, and building electrical systems for large hotels, hospitals, commercial, residential, and industrial projects.  Proficiency in planning tools such as Primavera Project Planner Software (Versions 3.1, 5.0, & 6.0) and Microsoft Project Professional is essential. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines

column2: Position: Planning Manager Experience: 8+ years in planning and project management within a developer firm Responsibilities: Lead and manage the planning department, overseeing all aspects of project planning and scheduling for development projects. Develop comprehensive project plans and schedules in coordination with project managers, architects, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure timely completion within budget. Conduct thorough analysis of project requirements, constraints, and risks, and develop effective strategies to mitigate risks and optimize project performance. Monitor project progress and milestones, identify deviations from the plan, and implement corrective actions to keep projects on track. Coordinate with internal departments and external stakeholders to facilitate communication and collaboration throughout the planning and execution phases of projects. Provide leadership and guidance to the planning team, fostering a culture of accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in project planning and management to drive efficiencies and improve processes. Establish and maintain relationships with vendors, subcontractors, and consultants to ensure alignment with project goals and objectives. Prepare and present regular reports and updates on project status, performance metrics, and key milestones to senior management and stakeholders. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in civil engineering, construction management, or related field. 8+ years of experience in planning and project management roles within a developer firm. Strong knowledge of project planning principles, methodologies, and tools. Proficiency in project management software, such as Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, or equivalent. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify issues, analyze data, and develop effective solutions. Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale development projects from conception to completion. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and effectively manage competing priorities and deadlines. Professional certifications or memberships related to project management (e.g., PMP, RICS, CIOB) preferred but not required.

column2: Tribeca is a contemporary and vibrant real estate brand that brought the Trump Organization to India and pioneered the concept of branded residences. Join us in our mission to create world-class real estate and customer experiences. Be a part of the Tribeca team and help us shape the future of luxury real estate in India.   Designation - Manager/ Senior Manager - Budgeting and Coting Website - https://www.tribecadevelopers.com/ News- https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/property-/-cstruction/tribeca-inks-pact-for-prime-project-in-mumbais-parel-secures-hdfc-capital-funding/articleshow/106697586.cms?from=mdr   Location: South Mumbai - Parel What this job involves:     Cost Estimation :   - Calculation of quantities based on drawings received  - Analysis and coordination of drawings from Architects, Structural and MEP consultants.  - Timely rate analysis of items required in the project (Parameter: location-wise, project type based analysis) Projects included Residential and commercial   Budget Monitoring :   - Make budget for various projects at different life stages and submit timely reports  - Cost monitoring budget v/s actual Rate Analysis   Cost Leadership :   - Generate ideas to minimize cost for each project  - Project Review Meetings  - Coordinates with the multiple site resources to conduct weekly project review meetings to update the other departments on the project status Qualifications and Technical competencies : BE/ BTech in civil. 7-12 years of experience in costing and Budgeting Strong communication and presentation skills High on quantitative aptitude Awareness of new technologies in the construction industry Knowledge of SAP, MS Project, ACONEX, AUTOCAD, MS Excel is an added advantage. Awareness of design principles Adept at construction practices including quality and safety norms   About the company Tribeca is the largest branded luxury developer in India! Established in 2012, we have grown to become the largest developer of Trump-branded properties in the world (after the Trump Organization). Our current employee strength comprises more than 150 associates across Mumbai, Pune, Delhi-NCR, Kolkata, and Bangalore, and we have a team of incredibly talented, hungry, bright, and passionate folks, including IIT, IIM, Wharton, and SPA toppers and industry stalwarts. At Tribeca, we are focused on creating world-class products and customer experiences. We pioneered the concept of branded residences in India and are developing over 6 million square feet of branded residential projects in India. We are also proud to be developing the world's largest rooftop terrace. We believe in contributing towards a sustainable environment and are committed to developing responsible homes that are energy efficient and use materials and resources that do not cause a negative impact on the environment.

column2: As a Planning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and managing project schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring the timely and efficient execution of various projects     Your role involves collaborating with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create comprehensive project plans, track progress, and identify potential risks and delays     You will play a crucial role in optimizing project timelines and resource allocation to achieve project objectives within budget and on schedule       Key Responsibilities:       Develop detailed project schedules and plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability     Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones     Use project scheduling software (e g, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) to create and maintain project schedules, including critical path analysis     Monitor project progress and compare it with the planned schedule, identifying deviations and potential delays     Analyze resource allocation and workload distribution to ensure efficient utilization of resources     Conduct potential delays or challenges     Prepare and present periodic reports, dashboards, and analysis of project schedules and performance to senior management     Coordinate with various departments to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities     Review and evaluate project change requests and assess their impact on project schedules analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project timelines and identify potential risks     Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate with project teams and stakeholders     Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously     Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices     Understanding of construction column1: Job Opening For Quantity Surveyor (QS) with Planswift Expertise
column2: Job Title: Quantity Surveyor (QS) with Planswift Expertise Education: Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering Experience: 12 - 18 Years Location: Head Office, Hyderabad Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Quantity Surveyor (QS) with expertise in Planswift software to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for utilizing Planswift to perform accurate quantity takeoffs, cost estimations, and planning activities for construction projects. As a QS with Planswift proficiency, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the success and profitability of our projects by providing detailed and precise estimates, as well as contributing to effective project planning and management. Utilize Planswift software to perform quantity takeoffs from digital drawings, including measurements of lengths, areas, volumes, and counts of various construction materials. Generate detailed cost estimates for construction projects based on Planswift quantity takeoffs, considering labor, materials, equipment, and other associated expenses. Collaborate with project stakeholders, including architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors, to review plans, specifications, and project requirements. Analyse and interpret project documents to identify scope, specifications, and potential risks or opportunities for cost savings. Assist in the preparation of project budgets and bids by providing accurate quantity and cost information derived from Planswift. Contribute to project planning activities, including scheduling, resource allocation, and procurement planning, to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Monitor project progress and update quantity takeoffs and cost estimates as necessary throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct regular cost analysis and variance reporting to identify discrepancies between estimated and actual costs, and recommend corrective actions as needed. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and advancements in construction technology, particularly related to quantity surveying and estimating software like Planswift. Provide support and guidance to junior QS staff on the use of Planswift and best practices for quantity surveying and estimating.
column11: Planswift, Material Takeoff, Quantitly Surveyor, Quantity Takeoff
