column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Civil Quantity Surveyor & Billing Manager to join our real estate team. The candidate will be responsible for managing all aspects of quantity surveying and billing processes for our construction projects. This includes preparing, monitoring, and managing project costs, ensuring compliance with contractual obligations, and liaising with various stakeholders to ensure project financial success. Key Responsibilities:     Quantity Surveying:   Prepare detailed estimates, bills of      quantities, and cost plans. Conduct site inspections and assessments to      gather information for cost calculations. Evaluate tender documents, drawings, and      specifications to ensure compliance. Negotiate and manage contracts with      contractors and suppliers. Conduct feasibility studies to estimate      materials, time, and labor costs. Prepare and analyze costing for tenders,      including project budgets and cash flow forecasts. Billing Management:   Prepare and submit monthly billing and progress reports. Verify and certify vendor and subcontractor bills. Manage and maintain accurate records of all project expenses. Coordinate with the finance team to ensure timely payments to vendors and suppliers. Ensure all billings are in accordance with the contract terms and conditions. Resolve any billing discrepancies and handle any financial disputes. Project Management:   Monitor project progress and report on financial performance. Work closely with project managers, site engineers, and other stakeholders. Ensure compliance with safety regulations and quality standards. Assist in project planning and scheduling to ensure timely delivery. Conduct post-project analysis to evaluate cost performance and recommend improvements. Documentation & Reporting:   Maintain comprehensive records of all project documentation. Prepare detailed project reports and presentations for senior management. Ensure proper documentation and archiving of all financial records. Stakeholder Management:   Liaise with contractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders. Address any vendor concerns and provide regular updates on project status. Collaborate with the design and procurement teams to optimize project outcomes. Qualifications & Requirements: Education:  Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Quantity Surveying, or related field. A Master's degree or professional certification preferred. Experience:  Minimum of 10 years of experience in quantity surveying and billing management, preferably in the real estate sector. Skills: Strong analytical and numerical skills. Excellent knowledge of construction methods and materials. Proficient in quantity surveying software (e.g., AutoCAD, MS Projects) and MS Office Suite. Strong negotiation and communication skills. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills. Knowledge of relevant Indian construction laws and regulations.

Daily share of DLR and DPR to management. 9. *Continuous Improvement:* Identifying areas for improvement in the planning and scheduling processes and implementing changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. column2: The Planning Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of project planning, including land use planning, zoning regulations, and site development.          Schedule and Timetable Management:       Develop and maintain schedules, timetables, and calendars for projects, activities, or events.   Coordinate with relevant departments or teams to ensure alignment with organizational goals.       Resource Allocation:       Allocate and manage resources, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to meet project or activity requirements.   Optimize resource utilization to minimize waste and maximize efficiency.       Deadline Enforcement:       Monitor project or task progress and ensure that deadlines are met.   Identify potential delays and take proactive measures to mitigate them.       Collaboration and Communication:       Collaborate with different departments, teams, and stakeholders to gather information and requirements for planning.   Communicate schedules and timelines to all relevant parties, ensuring clarity and understanding.       Risk Management:       Identify potential risks and obstacles that may impact schedules or project completion.   Develop contingency plans and solutions to address unforeseen issues.       Documentation and Reporting:       Maintain detailed records of schedules, timelines, and resource allocation.   Generate regular reports on project or activity progress for management and stakeholders.       Process Improvement:       Continuously evaluate planning processes and recommend improvements for increased efficiency.   Implement best practices in time management and planning.
column11: resource management, risk management, project management, resource, project scheduling, documentation, process improvement, resource allocation, planning management, project monitoring, project execution, resource utilization, project planning, reporting

column2: A Billing Engineer/quantity surveyor (QS)  is responsible for managing all costs related to construction projects. primarily estimate and monitor project costs, from the early design to the final construction stages.   Quantity surveyors monitor ongoing construction projects and ensure they are completed within the projected budget and schedule. They work closely with project managers, architects, engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure a project is cost-effective and meets quality standards.  Role & responsibilities  Conduct quantity surveying and billing activities for building projects. Perform rate analysis and draft tender documents for project submissions. Prepare Bills of Quantity (BOQ) specifications. Generate and reconcile Running Account Bills for ongoing projects. Develop Bar Bending Schedules for construction projects. Prepare estimates and rate analysis for variation works in projects. Estimation of quantities as per Drawing Preparation of Price Adjustment statement on RA Bills Attending Kick Off meetings and preparation of mom Preparation of Work Orders. Preparation of contractors running & final bills as per Work Order conditions. Physical measurement of quantities and tracking the productivity. Checking and certifying quantities with the clients engineer. Checking monthly reconciliation of material for Every Bill. Sound Knowledge of ERP & AutoCAD.   Preferred candidate profile Experienced-  Residential & High-rise Apartments. Perks and benefits-  Best in Industry Require only Male Candidate

column2: A Planning Manager in civil engineering oversees the planning, coordination, and management of construction projects. Their responsibilities often include: Project Planning and Scheduling : Developing detailed project plans and schedules, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation. Coordination and Communication : Liaising with project stakeholders, including clients, contractors, and government authorities, to ensure alignment and clear communication throughout the project lifecycle. Resource Management : Allocating and managing resources such as labor, materials, and equipment to ensure efficient project execution. Risk Management : Identifying potential risks and developing mitigation strategies to minimize project delays and cost overruns. Budgeting and Cost Control : Establishing project budgets and monitoring costs to ensure the project remains within financial constraints. Quality Assurance : Ensuring that all construction activities comply with industry standards, regulations, and project specifications. Progress Monitoring : Tracking project progress and performance, making adjustments as needed to stay on schedule. Documentation and Reporting : Maintaining comprehensive project documentation and preparing regular reports for stakeholders on project status, issues, and achievements

Responsible for providing BOQ of all Construction Activity to prepare Final Budget on given timeline.    3. Responsible for accurate estimates and quantities of material to purchase Labour to billing.   4. To support Site, ERP, Purchase, Contracts Billing Dept. in Providing BOQ on given timeline.   5. To support Store Dept. in monthly Material Audit.   6. To support Construction Management in Reconciliation.   7. Responsible for all QS related activity.           1) Area calculation :   Work out Slab Area to derive constant   Work out Slab Area for billing purpose for activity RCC BBM Plaster work from Working RCC drawing.     2) Quantity Survey   Quantification of all Construction Activities to prepare initial Final Budget.   Quantification of Material Qty of all construction activity and provide to Site, Purchase, Contracts, Billing and ERP uploading.   Quantification of Labour Qty of all construction activity and provide to Site, Contracts, Billing and ERP uploading.     3) Listing and updating   Prepare Material Rate List and update it on time to time.   Prepare Labour Rate List and update it on time to time.   Derive and Maintain Qty constants, Material Constants of various construction activities.     4) Budget formation :    Rate Analysis of various work items wherever required.   Preparation of Activity Budget with help of Senior.   Prepare BOQ for initial Final Budget.   Preparation Drawing Assumption list used for Budgeting.   Incorporate changes in Budgets Drawings as per site checking.     5) Verification Reconciliation   Jointly checking quantities with Site Engineer with specifications of all items and obtaining approval of concerned authorities on it.   Prepare reconciliation of all major items (as decided by Management) on completion of every mile stone. On site Area Verification.     6) Support Coordination     Architect Dept:   Workout Design wastage for tiles it helps to redesigning and value addition.   Suggestion to reduce wall thickness.   Follow up for latest Drawing revision and specification     Contracts Department:   Provide Builtup Area calculation to finalize contract for RCC BBM Plaster Work.   Providing BOQ of all construction activities to finalize work contract.     Support to Billing Department:   Providing final quantities area for billing purpose    Providing material reconciliation to debit/Rating contractor.     Support to ERP Department:   Providing BOQ in ERP format to upload in system     Support to Site:   Providing BOQ of all construction activity.   Support to reconcile material    Support to Quantity verification finalization.   Providing material Quantity for indenting.   Coordination with site engineer for all QS related activity.     7) Supplementation:   To change all budgets as per site.   To change all budgets as per revised Drawings.   To change all budgets as per revised Specification.   To change all budgets as per revised labor Material rates.   To change all budgets as per revised labor Material activities.       8) Value engineering:    To compare all budgets as per working methods.   To compare Rate analysis of same activities with different working material methods.   Workout Design wastage it helps to redesigning and value addition.   To check all drawings suggest alternate changes to reduce cost.     9) Record Keeping Updating:   Final area in soft copy.   Finalize quantities as per site in Soft hard copy.   Reconciliation of various work items.   Monthly material stock audit. column2: Artech India is looking for Executive - Contract to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.      The Executive - Contract plays a crucial role in managing the contract lifecycle within an organization      They are responsible for drafting, reviewing, and negotiating contracts, ensuring compliance with legal standards and internal policies      This role involves collaboration with various departments to support the organization's contractual needs          Key Responsibilities:          Contract Drafting: Prepare, draft, and review contracts, agreements, and legal documents, ensuring accuracy, clarity, and adherence to legal requirements      Contract Negotiation: Collaborate with external parties, such as clients, vendors, and partners, to negotiate contract terms and conditions to achieve favorable outcomes for the organization      Legal Compliance: Ensure that contracts and agreements comply with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards      Contract Management: Oversee the complete contract lifecycle, from creation and negotiation to execution and archiving      Risk Assessment: Evaluate the potential risks and legal implications associated with contracts and provide recommendations to mitigate those risks      Document Tracking: Maintain a record of all contracts, track their status, and provide regular updates on contract obligations and deadlines      Contract Amendments: Assist in the preparation of contract amendments, extensions, and renewals      Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with various departments, including legal, procurement, sales, and finance, to address their specific contract needs      Vendor and Supplier Relationships: Manage relationships with vendors, suppliers, and other external partners through contract negotiations and compliance      Contract Reporting: Generate reports and summaries related to contract performance, obligations, and key terms

column2: Tribeca is a contemporary and vibrant real estate brand that brought the Trump Organization to India and pioneered the concept of branded residences. Join us in our mission to create world-class real estate and customer experiences. Be a part of the Tribeca team and help us shape the future of luxury real estate in India . Designation -   Manager Billing   Website -  https://www.tribecadevelopers.com/ News -  https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/property-/-cstruction/tribeca-inks-pact-for-prime-project-in-mumbais-parel-secures-hdfc-capital-funding/articleshow/106697586.cms?from=mdr Location:  South Mumbai - Parel What this job involves:   Billing and contracts, ensuring accurate and timely billing processes and efficient contract administration.  Prepare and review contract documents, including scope of work, specifications, and payment terms.  Conduct regular reviews of billing documents, invoices, and reports to ensure accuracy and compliance with contractual agreements.  Study of BOQ (Bill of Quantity) as per specifications and taking out quantities from drawings. Certification of RA bills. COP preparation.  Civil & Finishing Works Quantification. Preparation of vendor work orders for final process, amendments of work orders in portal making of Site work orders and purchase orders, labour Bill's, non technical bills, supply bills, debits, provisions, coordination with contractors and site team, financial records checking, SES making , Parking of bills, Material consumption checking.  Quantity Surveying including bar bending schedule and percentage billing work for R.C.C and blockwork, plaster work, reconciliation of all material  Civil, MEP, Consultant, Finishing - Handling Start to Finish Building All activities.    About the company Tribeca is the largest branded luxury developer in India! Established in 2012, we have grown to become the largest developer of Trump-branded properties in the world (after the Trump Organization). Our current employee strength comprises more than 150 associates across Mumbai, Pune, Delhi-NCR, Kolkata, and Bangalore, and we have a team of incredibly talented, hungry, bright, and passionate folks, including IIT, IIM, Wharton, and SPA toppers and industry stalwarts. At Tribeca, we are focused on creating world-class products and customer experiences. We pioneered the concept of branded residences in India and are developing over 6 million square feet of branded residential projects in India. We are also proud to be developing the world's largest rooftop terrace. We believe in contributing towards a sustainable environment and are committed to developing responsible homes that are energy efficient and use materials and resources that do not cause a negative impact on the environment.

column2: Job Summary: We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Planning manager to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinate and supervise a variety of projects, monitor a department or project's budget, inventory, and production schedule helps to build a roadmap to achieve the goals of the organization and directs all activities towards that course of action. Responsibilities: Preparing planning and new housing proposals in line with company strategy. Obtaining planning consent for proposals. Liaising with the planning team on the development of new site proposals. Keeping up to date with planning regulations, policy and legislation. Preparing supporting documentation for proposals including key data related to projects: land use, occupancy rates, infrastructure support, demographic and costing facts and figures. Attending and presenting at proposal meetings, planning consent boards, appeal panels and public inquiries. Preparing budgets and overseeing the financial administration of planning projects. Communicating with key stakeholders involved in the project including external and government agencies. Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility Ensure resource availability and allocation Develop a detailed project plan to track progress Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques Report and escalate to management as needed, perform risk management to minimize project risks Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendor, Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation. Preparation of Budget and Tracking the actual expenses, Preparation of Weekly MIS for Ongoing site, ensure empanelment of various Consultants as required. Coordinate internally with all concerned teams for concerned projects (Budgeting, Tendering & Contracts, Billing, Liaison, Legal, Architecture, Site), Coordinate with external consultants, Prepare weekly Project updates for management review Jointly Prepare and sign off on the corrective action steps with Project Manager. Ensure that the agreed corrective action/ steps are executed on site. Ensure the project is run as per timelines without compromising on the quality and cost at any stage. Conducting Review Meetings at Regular intervals; Preparing & circulating Minutes of the Meeting. Review and expedite the targets as prescribed in the Minutes of the Meeting. Studying and Analysing the MIS and then reporting it to the Project Director. Maintaining all project related Information in soft copy format which includes drawings, Calculations, Municipal approvals and other such documents in soft copy format for necessary submissions to the Project Director, if required. To be the single point of contact for all details related to the project (s) handled both for the internal and external agencies including compliances. Key skills Outstanding research skills together with an in-depth knowledge project planning process. Analytical ability to understand and interpret data for a range of audiences. Exemplary administration skills with an ability to make sound and appropriate judgements and problem solving at each stage of the planning process. Solid project management skills with an ability to be flexible when required. Strong numeracy skills with some experience of managing complex budgets. An ability to priorities workloads and juggle competing demands. Multi-tasking. Good listening skills with an aptitude for superior written and verbal communications. Faultless planning skills including deep understanding of the planning consent process. Client facing competencies with the ability to present and communicate at senior levels and across a range of stakeholders. Keen knowledge and expertise of planning practice legislation across England and Wales. Problem solving flair with creative skillfulness. Experienced in using planning software and data systems. Good interpersonal skills and a team player. Relevant experience BE Civil/ Post Graduation in construction Management or similar specialization and must have work experience relevant role. Five to 10 years proven experience in planning. Computer literacy (MS Office applications, in particular), Excellent organizational skills, with an ability to prioritize important projects. Should have good Communication and Interaction skills and negotiation skills. Extensive experience of the planning process from preparation and submission to consent and appeal. Evidence of previous report writing and making recommendations on major planning applications. Analytical track record for using and translating data for proposal planning purposes. Experienced in planning laws and related legislation. Project management know-how with previous experience of taking planning projects through the stages from formation to finalisation. Skilful in planning and software computer programmes.

Software Proficiency:    - Utilize MS Office, especially Excel, for project documentation and data analysis.    - Use advanced Excel functions for project tracking and reporting.

column2: Role & responsibilities   ONLY THE CANDIDATES HAVING EXPERIENCE OF GOVERNMENT CIVIL WORK WILL BE ENTERTAINED AND THE SALARY WILL BE BEST IN INDUSTRY Responsible for the study of BOQ (Bill of Quantity) as per specifications and taking out quantities from drawings and to be able to prepare as-built drawings. Preparation and Certification of RA bills. Identification and preparation of extra items. Preparation of monthly reconciliation statement of building material. Responsible for verification of certified RA bills. Preparing all billing records and marinating them. Proper centering of bills without errors Preparing RA Bills for the Projects (Client and Sub Contractor bills) on a Monthly basis. Getting Approval from the Client. Providing billing-related information/documents to clients as and when required. Arithmetic & technical checking of all bills i.e. Civil, Carpentry, Aluminum Windows, Finishing, Interior bills, Infrastructure, Plumbing, Firefighting, Electrical work, consultants, & material Invoices, etc. Site Visits: - Random Physical checking of bills at site case to case. Material Reconciliation: - To check theoretical consumption of steel, cement & other material supplied free of cost to the contractor and make recovery in case of excess Consumption & wastage. Other duties specified by Site In-charge or In-charge in Commend. The increment and bonus are based on the performance of the engineer and we encourage our officials as per their hardworking and truthfulness and workman-ship.   Schedule: Day shift Supplemental pay types: Yearly bonus Education: Diploma (Required) Experience: Government Billing: 5 years (Required) CPWD Exp- (Required)
